loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is married with three children. Juan is 46 years old and lives in Poblacion, Salug, Zamboanga del Norte.

Juan is a farmer who plants rubber trees to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested to buy seedlings for his rubber plantation.

Juan has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Juan hopes to maintain his rubber plantation.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for his rubber plantation

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, ella vende sus ricos platos de comida todos los días desde las 6am hasta que se acaben. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilcopata” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos por ejemplo verduras, carne de gallina, carne de cordero, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Silvia thanks the investors for the loan and the help provided to her. She continues selling her delicious food as a street vendor, everyday from 6 am until everything runs out. For several years now she has been part of the communal bank “Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilcopata” and this time she is requesting the loan to buy inputs like vegetables, chicken and lamb meat, sacks of rice and sugar and other products. 

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata District in Paucartambo Province in the Cusco Region, Peru).

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken and lamb meat, sacks of rice and sugar and other products.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра вдова, имеет двоих детей. Она живет вместе со своими детьми в столице своей страны. Она имеет высшее образование, так как окончила Таджикский Национальный Университет, по специальности экономиста. Гулчехра работает в государственной организации. По характеру Гулчехра очень дружелюбная, ответственная  и добросовестная женщина. Воспитывает детей одна, так как ее мужа убили во время гражданской войны. Старший сын студент учится хорошо. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a widow with two children.  She lives with her children in her country's capital.  She has a higher education in economics from the National University of Tajikistan and she works for the government.  Gulchehra is a very friendly, responsible and conscientious woman.  She is raising her children alone, as her husband died in the civil war.  Her elder son is a good student.  She needs to pay for his tuition, but she doesn't have enough money.  She is asking for a loan of $1,000 USD to pay for his tuition.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a woman of forty years, married to Obadiah, and together they have one child. Beatrice does crop farming in Limuru and has been in this business for six years now. She gets a monthly income of around ten thousand shillings. 

This will be Beatrice’s second loan from VisionFund Kenya and she plans to use the entire amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her crops. In the future she wants to educate her child and be a prosperous business lady.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.ru: Иззат трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Всей своей дружной семьёй они живут в сельской деревушке. Так как она имеет большую семью, ей приходится вместе с мужем много работать, чтобы иметь достаточный доход для обеспечения своей семьи. Иззат вот уже несколько лет сотрудничает с Арванд, получая кредит на развитие своего бизнеса. Она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Рядом с домом у них имеется площадь земли, где они выращивают пшеницу и потом продают. Тем самым получают прибыль. А также в будущем она хочет начать выращивать скот, а потом продавать полученное от них мясо и молоко. А сейчас ей необходимо закупить семена пшеницы для посева. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку семян. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Izzat is a hard-working and cheerful woman.  She is married with six children.  All her family are very close and they live in a village.  Since she has a large family, Izzat and her husband have to work hard to bring in enough money to take care of their children.  Izzat has been working with Arvand for several years now, receiving loans to help grow her business.  She is involved in agriculture.  Next to her home she has a plot of land on which she grows wheat, which she then sells to make her income.  In the future, she would like to start raising livestock so she can sell their meat and milk, but at the moment she needs to buy seeds to sow her wheat.  This is why she has turned to Arvand to receive a loan to buy these seeds.  Izzat is hoping for good results and she thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru: Абдували 20 лет, не женат, проживает с родителями. У Абдували - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Абдували занимается животноводством вместе со своими родителями, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Абдували, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 50 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Абдували обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Абдували планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Abduvalli is 20 years old.  He is not married and he lives with his parents.  He has a high school education and as the main source of income for his family, he raises livestock together with his parents.  They started this business five years ago with the purchase of livestock for 15,000 som KGS.  Thanks to Abduvali's hard work, their farm now has two dairy cows and 50 sheep.  Their monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing the business further, Abduvali has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy sheep so they can increase their head of livestock.  He plans to reinvest the income from this loan back into the business to further increase the size of their herd.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena is a Ugandan married woman, age 29, living in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop with general merchandise, but also sells local brew in order to earn a living. 

Like most people in this business she is challenged by price fluctuation and inadequate capital, while her desire is to educate her children up to the University and build a commercial house so as to earn extra income. 

The high cost of rent and customers not paying on time affect her business growth, while her dream is to trade in wholesale. Madalena is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 62 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a dry goods business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 5 years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods to sell, like bags, slippers, sandals, blouses, etc. Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods to sell, like bags, slippers, sandals, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Amour De Dieu Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Shamamba est une brave commerçante d’une expérience 7 ans et membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Amour de Dieu » âgée de 46 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle stocke ses marchandises dans un dépôt  du  centre commercial de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle va acheter 5 sacs de farine manioc, 4 sacs de farine de maïs, 100 litres d’huile végétale, 2 sacs de farine de soja, 7 sacs de sel iodé, 4 cartons de tomates en boite. Au début, elle avait reçu de fonds de son mari(lors de son vivant). Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et assurer les mieux êtres de ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur donnant de microcrédits sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues  du system bancaire classique, surtout, dans la période de conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client Shamamba is a good merchant who has seven years of experience, and is a member the business association "Amour de Dieu" ("Love of God"). Shamamba is a widow and mother to seven children who all are studying. She is a food merchant. She purchases her merchandise in a warehouse in the commercial center of the city.

Shamamba is requesting a loan from Hekima to help her business grow. She plans to purchase five sacks of cassava flour, four sacks of corn flour, 100 liters of vegetable oil, two sacks of soy flour, seven sacks of iodized salt, and four cartons of canned tomatoes. When she started her business, she received money from her husband (during his lifetime). Shamamba hopes to increase her capital, and to educate and ensure better things for her children.

She thanks Hekima for their support of women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system through granting them micro loans without requiring tangible security, especially during the period of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of cassava flour, four sacks of corn flour, 100 liters of vegetable oil, two sacks of soy flour, seven sacks of iodized salt, and four cartons of canned tomatoes.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is 36-year-old married woman. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children and passing her life peacefully with her husband. She belongs with the middle standard family and her husband has only a single source of income, which is sheltering services. Her financial condition is neither good nor bad, as her husband earns enough to feed her family. 

Now her children are halfway grown and have started going to higher school. It is a new expense for her husband. To meet school fee expenses and the expenses of their books are out of his earning capacity.

Because of that her husband decided to grow his sheltering business but he does not have savings or extra capital for further investment. Therefore, Khursheed requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, who is a field partner of Kiva. Khursheed is very thankful to Kiva because now the family is ready to meet new expenses.

loans.use: To buy sheltering material for providing sheltering services.

loans.name: Padmalaya Self Help Group

texts.en:
Jhuna is 37 years old, living with her husband and two children who are studying in school. She is engaged in the activity of selling dry and fresh fish in the market which is four kilometers away from her village. Her husband catches fish from a small part of the Chilika Lake which is near their village (Chilika is a famous lake in Odisha known for the migratory birds). The demand for fish in the region is very high as it is consumed by most of the people. Jhuna makes dried fish by keeping fish in sunlight until all the water in them gets evaporated which preserves them for future use (like when fish are not available in the market, in the rainy season). Dried fish is also used as a supplement to fresh fish. 

Jhuna is requesting a loan to buy a cool storing box for keeping fish, fishing net and insecticides to prevent fish from decaying for her fishery/fish selling business. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand.

This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the group Padmalaya Self Help Group (SHG). The members of the group have selected Jhuna as their president. The lady standing sixth from right in the photo is Jhuna. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: To buy a cool storing box for keeping fish, fishing net and insecticides to prevent fish from decaying for her fishery business.

loans.name: Manas

texts.en:
Manas is a freshman in the International and Business Law program; this is his story:

To study International and Business Law at AUCA has been my goal since I started thinking about going to university. Law is interesting for me because I love talking with and helping other people, and I am able to put myself in their shoes and think about how they feel. I think these are very important qualities for a lawyer.

I always think about how I can help Kyrgyzstan. It’s unstable and in need of international donor support. A lot of the instability is because we do not have a strong legal system to enforce contracts. I want to help build this system because I am sure that we can bring in more investment for our economy, our education, and our society.

AUCA is the most prestigious and the most popular university in Central Asia. It teaches with modern methods and has advanced technologies to train students. I would like to study at AUCA in order to strengthen my knowledge, so that I can contribute to the future of my country.

loans.use: to pay for his education

loans.name: Maléki

texts.fr:
Maléki est un homme âgé de 26 ans. Il est marié à une  couturière et ont  ensemble un enfant de 06ans.  
Maléki travaille comme revendeur de cartes de recharges. 
Il est distributeur de cartes et fait également des transferts de crédits dans les environs de la ville de Lomé. Ses marchandises sont achetées chez les grossistes. 
Maléki a requis son sixième crédit de WAGES afin d’augmenter son activité par l’achat des cartes de recharge. Il souhaiterait assurer l'éducation de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maléki is a 26-year-old man. He is married to a seamstress, and together they have a six-year-old child. Maléki works as a seller of mobile phone recharge cards. He is a card distributor and also makes credit transfers of in the vicinity of the city of Lomé. His merchandise is purchased from wholesalers.

Maléki has requested his sixth loan from WAGES to increase his business by purchasing recharge cards. His wish is to ensure the education of his family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Yaovi est un homme âgé de 39ans. Il est marié à une coiffeuse avec 02 enfant de 04 et 01an.
Yaovi travaillait comme revendeur de produits génériques et actuellement, il achète les appareils électroniques (télévisions,radio...) pour revendre.  
Yaovi a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des appareils électroniques. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité afin d’assurer une bonne éducation à sa famille.
texts.en:
Yaovi is a 39-year-old man. He is married to a hairdresser, and has two children, aged one and four years old. Yaovi worked as a reseller of generic drugs, and currently purchases electronics (televisions, radios...) to resell.

Yaovi is requesting his third loan from WAGES so that he can purchase electronics. He wants to reinvest in his business with the aim of ensuring a good education for his family.

loans.use: to purchase electronics for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a woman of forty years, married to Job and a mother of two children. She is a green grocer, and she has been in this business for eight years now. She gets a monthly income of about fifty thousand nine hundred shillings. 

This will be Esther’s fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy a variety of groceries for her business. In the future she wants to raise her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy fruits, tomatoes, eggs and other foods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Merenciana

texts.en:
This is Merenciana, 48, resident of Inrtamuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Cesario, a construction worker and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Merenciana maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Merenciana dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes the family will have their own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Perpetue

texts.fr: Perpétue est une femme de 45 ans, célibataire et mère de 4 enfants. elle possède et gère un bar où elle vend des boissons hygiéniques et alcoolisés depuis 3 ans dans un quartier de la ville. dynamique et soucieux de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Perpétue is a 45 year old woman, and a single mother of four children. She owns and operates a bar in a district of the city where she has been selling soft drinks and alcohol for three years.

Dynamic and eager to satisfy her customers, Perpétue is requesting this loan to increase her stock of merchandise so that she can increase her turnover. The income she earns will be reinvested into her business and used to pay for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school. She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 5 years.

Erlinda requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, like shorts, blouses, t-shirts, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like shorts, blouses, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years now. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, shrimp, salt, etc. for her business. In the future, Esmeralda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, shrimp, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Abanti

texts.en:
Abanti is 35 years old, a widow who lives in a small village of Odisha, a state in Eastern India. She lives with her brother and daughter. Her husband passed away five years ago, which is why she and her daughter now live with her brother. Before his death, her husband was running a vegetable shop in the village. He left the business to Abanti, and she runs it alone so that she can support her daughter and contribute to the household expenses, as her brother is also somewhat dependent upon her. In the shop, She sells potatoes, tomatoes, onions, beans, cauliflower, seasonal  vegetables, and spices such as ginger. From this activity she earns 5000 INR per month. 

Now she would like to open a new vegetable shop at the larger nearby market so that she can earn more money. For this, she needs financial support. She has requested a loan amount of 15,000 INR, which she will match with 15,000 INR from her personal savings, and she will purchase scales, racks, bigger baskets, vegetables items, and make an advance payment on the rent for the shop.  She’s confident this will increase her income significantly and allow her to help increase the standard of living for her family and provide for a good education for her daughter.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing scales, racks, bigger baskets, vegetables items, and making advance payment of rent for the shop.

loans.name: Amilcar Vladimir

texts.en:
Amilcar wants to become an auto mechanic. To achieve his goal, Amilcar has enrolled in the Universidad Tecnologica Umsa. He expects to graduate in November, 2017 but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. 

Amilcar shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter the job market as soon as possible. With a loan, Amilcar plans on purchasing his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Amilcar feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a career in automotive mechanics, he expects to earn $15 a day. As the youngest child, with one older sibling attending college already, Amilcar is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Kusnari

texts.en:
Kusnari runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Kusnari lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about 1,5 hours from Jakarta.  Kusnari is married and lives with three persons in their family house.

 Kusnari began working with Ruma one year ago because he was interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months he has had around $110 – 115 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Tophan

texts.en:
Tophan is 29 years old and is a differently-able man living with his parents, brother, wife and  young child in Odisha, a state in Eastern India. For ten years, he  has owned a cycle repair store and also sells new cycles and cycle parts. His experience makes him a very qualified mechanic and allows him to have a steady income. His father and brother support him with this business by bringing cycle parts from the market, as it is difficult for Tophan to get around due to his disability. 

Nevertheless, the cost of materials for his business is high and he would like to start purchasing items in bulk so he can get a lower purchasing price. He estimates this will help him almost double his monthly profits. For this project, he has requested a loan amount of 15,000 INR for purchasing necessary cycle parts like tyres, tubes, seat covers, latest repair tools, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing necessary cycle parts like tyres, tubes, seat covers, latest repair tools, etc. for his cycle repair shop.

loans.name: Unyenyekevu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Louise est une commerçante, présidente et membre d’une association d’affaires « Unyenyekevu», âgée  de 54 ans, veuve et mère des 7 enfants qui 4, étudient et 3 autres sont déjà mariés. Elle est vendeuse de  friperie(Sacs au dos usagés)depuis 4 ans. Elle installe ses marchandises sur la rue dans une avenue animée de la place. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle démarra ses activités par de fonds reçu de ses enfants. Elle va acheter 20 sacs au dos. Dans l’avenir,elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant,  ce moment critique post conflit dans la region de l’Est du pays..
texts.en:
Louise, age 54, is a merchant, and a member and the president of Unyenyekevu Group. She's a widow and the mother of seven children. Out of them, four are still studying, whereas the three others are already married.

She's been selling used clothing (secondhand backpacks) for the past four years. She sets up her products in a busy street of the place where she lives.

She's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business. She started it with funding received from her children.

She will buy 20 used backpacks. In the future, she wishes to bolster her working capital, send her children to school, and provide them with clothes and food.

She thanks Hekima for its support towards female entrepreneur who are excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this postwar time  in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy 20 used backpacks

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen Rosa agrade a los inversionistas por el préstamo y por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con la venta de comida en uno de los mercados principales de la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella vende sus ricos platos de comida todos los días desde las 6am hasta 4pm. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilcopata” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, menestras, carne de gallina, carne de cordero, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, frutas y otras cosas más. La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is grateful to lenders for the support provided. She continues to sell her delicious dishes in one of the main markets of the city of Pilcopata from 6am to 4pm. She has been a member of the communal bank "Señor de Qoyllorrity de Pilcopata" for several years and is now requesting a loan to buy ingredients, such as vegetables, hen meat, lamb, rice, sugar and fruit, among other items.

The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata district in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as hen meat, lamb, rice and sugar, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover web fees and market her business.

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru: Нуриле 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Нурилы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нурила занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурилы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 теленок, 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурила обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Nurila is 37 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Nurila has secondary education. As a main income for her family, Nurila works with livestock breeding, after having started 13 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nurila's persistent work, her farm currently has one calf and six sheep. The monthly income is 6,500 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Nurila turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase cows to feed and subsequently sell at the market at a higher price. Nurila plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cows for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Fatima Karen

texts.en:
Fatima wants to become an accountant. Fatima is currently attending the Instituto Tecnico Comercial La Paz, working towards her degree. With this loan, Fatima plans on purchasing her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Fatima feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a degree in accounting she expects to earn $20 a day. 

As the youngest child in her family, with one older sibling attending college already, Fatima is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Todd

texts.en:
Todd recently started an online retail and wholesale business, Imbue Motorsports, selling high-end, high quality off-road remote controlled cars, parts and accessories. The products Todd and Imbue Motorsports sells are some of the best in the business and are built for speed and to compete on the race track. 

Although based in Alabama, Todd’s business is international as he markets on the Internet using Facebook, Google and email marketing campaigns. In addition he sponsors racing competitions and tournaments and attends expos and trade shows dedicated to remote control cars and hobbies. Importing much of his inventory from Italy, Todd has already invested in inventory, tools, and time to build his business. 

Todd is trying to build his business on quality products and great customer service. Todd says he is already getting repeat business equaling roughly 10 percent of his current business. For more information on Todd’s products and inventory visit: www.imbuemotorsports.com/.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment.

loans.name: Liduvina Eulalia

texts.en:
Liduvina dreams of working in the hospitality industry. She was accepted into the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés and now with the chance to achieve her dream is concerned about affording her final graduation fees. She plans on graduating in June, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in La Paz. With a career in hospitality, Liduvina expects to earn $15 a day. 

Unfortunately, Liduvina's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to increase their earning potential. Because of this, the family's finances have always been tight. With six siblings, Liduvina is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is a 44-year-old who has managed his farming business for almost 30 years.Through his experience in his farming business he was able to make it productive. Now, the income he makes from his business helps him a lot, especially in covering his family's daily household expenses. However, he still hopes for continuous growth of his farming business.

Ferdinand is seeking an additional loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for the proper growth of his crops. He is hoping for approval of this amount so he will be able to increase his profit, which will enable him to educate his child and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his farming business

loans.name: Jersam

texts.en: Jersam owns and operates a food vending business in her local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than nine years and she earns well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used in her business. Currently she took a new loan to purchase raw ingredients in order to serve more customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: Rustico

texts.en: Rustico is a farmer who also helps his wife operate a general store to make a living. His wife has been running her business for three years and earns well from this. She took a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. Rustico wants improvement in the general living situation of his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the fertilizers, materials and supplies needed in her farm. She also has a garden and it received assistance as well from the loan that she acquired. The income from her business is helping pay their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire, baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Isidora dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes to help her grandchildren. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and materials for her farming business.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be motivated. He operates a retail business where he sells padlocks, basins, speakers, radios, caps, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to stock basins, padlocks, radios, caps, and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his 3rd loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to stock basins, padlocks, radios, caps and other items

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 45-year-old single woman.  She has one child who is 23-years-old.  She describes herself to be determined.  She operates a retail business where she sells liquid soap. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a rural area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy stock of chemicals for making soap. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy chemicals for making liquid soap. Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future she will excel. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for making liquid soap

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be very enterprising. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes, cooking pans, vacuum flasks, etc. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in an urban area with potential, and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the slow uptake of products. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add a stock of cooking pans, vacuum flasks, shoes and other items. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to sustain her family. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to add a stock of cooking pans, vacuum flasks, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Leria

texts.en:
Leria previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. Aside from her variety store, she also has a food stall.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business. She will also use the loan to buy grocery items for her variety store. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leria dreams that her business will continue and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a first time borrower applying for a loan of two million five hundred thousand Uganda shillings (2,500,000).  He is a single gentleman, but takes care of the needs of his siblings.  He is a bodaboda rider and stages at the trading center. He rides the motorcycle himself and has been involved with this for two years and he has been able to acquire a small plot that is not yet developed.  John says the business is not bad.  Thus, he is applying for a loan to purchase a second motorcycle to boost his cash inflow. Thus, John predicts an increase in his cash inflow by 30% in comparison with the past months.

John further says that he has plans to pay the loan so fast and apply for other loans to start constructing a house on his acquired plot.

loans.use: To buy a second motorcycle

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Amanecer está creciendo y mejorando cada día, forma parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, para poder ayudarlas a crecer y mejorar sus vidas, con las capacitaciones que reciben.
Nancy forma parte de este grupo, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir en un nivel medio, creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de bijouterie, aunque es un trabajo duro, está orgullosa de lo que hace ya que es muy honesto. También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones a todas las integrantes de este grupo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bijouterie, para poder seguir con sus ventas, y tratar de que por medio de ese trabajo pueda mejorar y crecer como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Amanecer group is growing and improving each day.  It’s part of the elimination of poverty program that helps the members grow and improve their lives with the training they receive.

Nancy is part of this group; she demonstrated a level two poverty level in the last survey, that is mid-level, but she is growing thanks to her effort and work.  She sells costume jewelry, although it’s hard work. She is proud of what she does because it’s honest.  We must also mention the work of the advisors, who are training and verifying all the members’ training.

She is asking for a loan to buy costume jewelry to be able to continue her sales and try to improve and grow as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Melati Group

texts.en:
This group has a considerable number of members, which requires great responsibility. Ni Ketut, as the head of the group, is a very responsible woman and able to manage group members well. Accompanied and controlled by a Loan Officer from MUK, the group manages the business well and makes payments on time. 

When Ni Ketut kept her pig, no problems occurred. All pigs developed well and were not affected by disease. The advantages for the family were an increase in income and the ability to set aside some savings. 
 
To further improve their businesses, the group has taken a new loan. Ni Ketut used it to buy superior piglets. Superior type prices are more stable and high. She has a plan to save all of the profit to use as venture capital later.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Triunfadoras es un grupo muy trabajador, es por eso que lleva ese nombre, ellas están formando parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, haciendo la encuesta y participando de las capacitaciones para poder crecer.
Gloria es una de las integrantes, quien hace comestibles ella misma, y que después sale a vender. Es una persona muy talentosa en lo que hace, y es por eso que le va muy bien en lo que hace, sus clientes siempre prefieren sus comidas porque son muy ricas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar insumos para sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y demás. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Winning Women) is a hardworking group and this is why it is named this way.  They are part of the elimination of poverty program, doing the survey and participating in the training so they can grow.

Gloria is one of the members and she makes food and then goes out to sell it.  She is a very talented person in what she does and this is why things are going well for her.  Her customers always prefer her foods because they are delicious.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy ingredients such as meats, condiments, vegetables, and other things.  She is grateful for all the opportunities she is getting.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 61 years old and does dairy farming in Kangundo town. She is married. She and her spouse, who is a mason, have been blessed with four children. Her spouse also provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last 10 years, and it has been profitable. 

She will use this loan to buy another dairy cow and be able to increase her milk production. She will use the generated profits to provide for her family's needs.

This is her third loan term. She paid all her previous loans successfully. In the future Joyce hopes to grow her dairy farming business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Садбарг 1983 года рождения. Она замужем, детей пока нет. В предпринимательстве Садбарг занимается более 1,5 года. Она имеет опыт работы в данной сфере. Бизнес клиента налажен хорошо. Садбарг занимается купля продажей женской одежды. Товар Садбарг покупает с рынка по оптовой цене и продает с наценкой у себя дома, своим соседям, постоянным клиентам, а также везет в район, где проживают ее родители, и продает там соседям родителей. Со слов клиентки в районе товар очень быстро покупают и это ей выгодно. В семье Садбарг живет с мужем, данный момент муж находиться в Российской Федерации, уехал на заработки. Садбарг хочет купить товар для Новогоднего сезона, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки одежды для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sadbarg was born in 1983.  She is married, but does not yet have children.  She has been an entrepreneur for more than 1.5 years, she is experienced working in her chosen field and she has many customers.  Sadbarg buys and sells women's clothing.  She buys her goods wholesale and retails them from her home to her neighbors and regular clients.  She also takes them to the region where her parents live and sells them to their neighbors.  Her clients say that her goods are affordable and very fast.  Sadbarg lives with her husband, but at the moment he is a migrant worker in Russia.  She wants to buy goods for the New Year's season, but she doesn't have enough money.  She is asking for a loan of 2,500 somoni to by clothing to increase her working capital.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy clothing to increase her working capital

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima works hard to support her family. Felicisima is married and has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines.

Felicisima requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 13 years now.

Felicisima would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 26-years-old.  She is married with two children.  Her husband works as a house builder. She sells different items in her boutique.  With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, soaps and sugar for sale. She wants to reinvest much in the business with the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soaps and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 56 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Felisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Felisa requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Felisa has been in this business for eight years. Felisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Consolate

texts.en: Consolate is a hardworking married woman with three children living in Hoima, Uganda.  She deals in second-hand shoes.  She started the business after realizing that farming alone would not enable her to support her family due to its seasonal nature.  Ever changing customer preferences and inadequate capital affect her business growth while her dream is to own a modern boutique.  Consolate is requesting a loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Luz Neira

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 31 años de edad está felizmente casada y es madre de dos hijos de 7 y 8 años. Se ha dedicado a trabajar como empleada en diferentes almacenes de ropa, donde adquirió la experiencia y el conocimiento necesario para tomar la decisión de independizarse; por lo que se dedicó a vender ropa de dama y niños para generar los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. 
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de surtido al por mayor (blusas, jeans, leggins, camisas, entre otros) y una estantería para almacenar las prendas; con esto podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de prendas para satisfacer la demanda y los diversos gustos de sus clientes, obteniendo así, un incremento notable en las ventas y en los ingresos que recibe de su labor.
Luz, una mujer apasionada por lo que hace, manifiesta que su principal anhelo es tener un local abierto al público en el que pueda ofrecer mayor diversidad de artículos y generar una mejor rentabilidad para dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y seguir solventando las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luz is a 31-year old woman who is happily married and has two children, aged 7 and 8. She has worked in different clothing stores, where she gained enough experience and knowledge to work independently. She started to sell women and children's clothing to generate income and help her husband with the household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes in bulk (blouses, jeans, leggings, shirts, etc.) as well as shelves to keep them. Thanks to this, she will be able to offer a wider variety of clothing items and to meet the demand and diverse taste of her clients, which would lead to a significant increase in sales and income. 

Luz is passionate about what she does and says that her biggest dream is to have a store open to the public where she could offer a wider selection of items and generate more income. This would allow her to provide her children with a better education and to continue to cover her household needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk (blouses, jeans, leggings, shirts, etc.) as well as shelves.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run is 51 years old and widowed. She lives in a rural village of Takeo province’s Koh Andeth district. She has four children, three of whom work as garment workers to help support the family. Another child is still in school. She earns a living by farming rice. Having been in this business for 30 years, she is able to earn about 10 USD per day to meet the needs of her family. 

Run has been with VisionFund for five cycles. She successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family with enough food. Now she is applying for another loan to pay for her son’s school fees to study finance and banking. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation. She also hopes it will help to relieve her family's financial burden so she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s school fees

loans.name: David

texts.ru: Давид позитивный и ответственный молодой парень. Он женат и имеет детей. Он живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Но дом, в котором они живут, маловат и не совсем  благоустроен для хорошего проживания в нём. Жена Давида домохозяйка, она очень трудолюбивая и заботливая мама. Сам Давид работает плотником в своём посёлке. От своей работы он получает хороший заработок. Этого дохода хватает ему только на проживание. Но у него есть мечта, Давид хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. Но для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. То, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Также ему помогает его отец, который работает в России строителем и присылает каждый месяц денежные средства. Поэтому Давид обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Davis is a positive and responsible young man. He is married and has children. He lives with his family in a small village. However the house in which they live is a little too small and not entirely well planned for good living. David's wife is a housewife. She is very hardworking and caring mother. David works as a carpenter in his village. He receives a good pay from his work. This income is sufficient for covering living expenses. 

However David has a dream; he would like to build a new house for his family. To do this he needs money and what he earns is not sufficient to afford building a new house. His father, who works in Russia as a builder, helps him through sending money every month. In addition, David turned to Arvand and would like to receive a loan to purchase building materials to build the house. He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the help.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is a 38-year-old single Cameroonian with two children. The oldest is 16 and in secondary school while the youngest is 6 and in primary school.

She has been in this business for over 12 years. She is very experienced and stable and her business is profitable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

This loan will increase her profit by 20 percent. Her standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and lotions for resale.

loans.name: Nongpok Ningthou Shg Group

texts.en:
Tombi is pictured with her hand raised and she is the featured profile member of Nongpok Ningthau. She lives with her husband and four children in Imphal East, Manipur which is in the Northeastern region of India. She has a son and three beautiful daughters. They are all in pre-secondary school. 

In order to supplement the family income, Tombi opened a variety store and seasonally rears chicken to generate more income. She is able to sell only 2,500 to 3,500 INR per day from the variety store. She keeps items like potato chips, rice, boxes of matches, detergent, etc in the shop. Her husband is a truck driver. 

With the meager income, having to take care of the children and household expenses, life isn't easy for them, says Tombi. She wishes to send her children to a good school and provide them with their basic daily requirements without fail. She wants to be financially independent because she believes it will give at least peace and harmony within the family. She thanks WSDS for being compassionate towards her and the group. Like Tombi, the rest of the group members are also engaged in poultry farms, shops, sand sifting, and weaving.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the shop such as salt, sugar and betel nut/leaf and to send her children to school.

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.ru: Асатулло жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 47 лет. Он женат и имеет четверо детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Недавно Асатулло женил своего старшего сына  и потратил на проведение свадьбы большую часть своих сбережений. Сам Асатулло зарабатывает на животноводстве и дехканстве. Он выращивает в своём небольшом саду фрукты и овощи. Хотя это сезонный бизнес, но он также приносит Асатулло доход. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Асатулло является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Асатулло хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Асатулло обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Асатулло заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Asatullo is a happy man of the age of 47. He is married and has four children. He has a very friendly family. They live in a village. In order to have enough income for the family, all family members are trying to somehow make money. Everyone works as they can. Not long ago, Asatullo married away his oldest son and spent a large share of his savings on holding the wedding. 

Asatullo works with cattle breeding and dekhan farming. He grows fruit and vegetables in his small garden. Even if it is a seasonal business, it still brings Asatullo an income. Asatullo's main and most stable business is cattle breeding. He breeds and sells cattle. His wife helps him with the business. She cares for the cattle and also sells the milk they give. 

Asatullo needs to purchase a few additional heads of cattle to breed and subsequently resell. For this, Asatullo turned to Arvand and would like to get a loan to purchase cattle. He hope that his business will expand successfully and bring in more money, in order to meet the family's needs better. Asatullo thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Amber Group

texts.en:
Amber is a 33-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and three daughters in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2010, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Amber is a member of two-person borrowing group, and she has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store, to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Amber and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To pay for goods for general store.

loans.name: Nongpok Panthoibi Shg Group

texts.en:
Pecha, the woman with her hand raised, is a member of Nongpok Panthoibi. She lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a mechanic who fixes vehicles in a workshop. In order to supplement the family income Pecha opened a variety shop in the market area. She sells 3000 to 4000 INR every day. In order to generate more income she keeps fresh vegetables from her own kitchen garden to fill up the store. 

Apart from the variety store, from time to time Pecha also sells women's clothes. She buys things at a lower price and sells them to get little extra profit. Pecha says, she and her husband have to work very hard to sustain the family and to send their children to school to get an education like other children. With the loan amount she wishes to expand and refill the shop. She thanks WSDS for being so gracious to her, and she believes that her burden will be much lighter now. Like her the rest of the group are engaged in sand sheaving, weaving and tending shop.

loans.use: To buy more products such as rice, cereals, sugar and betel nut/leaf so as to improve her family’s living conditions and increase their income.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
To make a living, Angelina operates a general store while her husband does farming. She has been in her business for many years and she earns well from this. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used for business improvement. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

She hopes to earn additional profits from her the business, so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en: Suhrob was born in 1979, and is a hardworking and industrious man. He is married and has a child. He is busy with selling clothes as he has a selling place in a local market. Suhrob began this business 13 years ago and he has a lot of experience. He is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit history - from early loans he increased his working capital. Now Suhrob wants to develop his business further, and he is asking for a loan of 12,000 somoni to buy men’s clothes to sell. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy men’s clothes to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie helps her husband on their farm during planting and harvesting. But most of her time is spent operating her retail store for a living. She earns well from this and successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used for buying inventory capital. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods  to sell. Some of her revenue was used on the farm to improve their harvest. She plans to expand her store and is hopeful of improving their living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods  to sell

loans.name: Wycliff

texts.en:
Wycliff lives in the Kitale area of Northrift Kenya, an area known for high poultry production and consumption. He is married and has 3 children, and he has been involved with agriculture for 12 years. He produces and sells milk, eggs, vegetables and maize. He enjoys dairy farming the most, as it earns him more income. The main challenges he faces are diseases affecting his livestock.

Wycliff chose Juhudi Kilimo because he has seen other beneficiaries of Juhudi Kilimo loans in his local area and he decided to try it out. During the training offered, he learned that Juhudi is a micro-finance organization which finances farmers with short term loans. His highest monthly expense is school fees, and so through the dairy loan he will earn more income and thus be able to take care of his children's school fees. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for granting him the loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mbabazi

texts.en:
Mbabazi is a first-time borrower applying for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX. She is married and has three children and stays in a rental house in a suburb  where she runs the business of sell of green bananas. She has been running this banana business for over seven years, and she has been able to acquire a small plot of land.

Now she is putting up a residential house, but money is not enough, and thus she is applying for a loan to finish the residential house and avoid paying rent.

She says she is going to save the money that has always been spent on rent to increase capital in her banana business, She will use the profits from the business to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy materials to finish her house under construction

loans.name: Nuki

texts.en:
Meet Nuki. Nuki is a housewife and has two children. Her 9-year-old daughter is going to elementary school and her second daughter is an 8-month-old baby girl. 

They live in the family home in Cibubur, a suburban area located about 30 minutes from Jakarta. Nuki's husband is an employee in a private company. To help her husband cover her family's needs, Nuki runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits, and she services bill payments for her customers. 

Nuki joined Ruma because she wants to improve her business. She is glad that her business is being assisted and supported by Ruma agents. For the last three months, she has got around $15-$16 per day in sales on average, just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends when more people tend to come to her stall. In the future, she is planning to seek more business opportunities.

 In the photo, Nuki is standing in front of her small stall with her elder daughter. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Sutrisna

texts.en:
Meet Sutrisna. He's is a single man who lives in Serang, a suburban area located about 30 minutes from Jakarta, the capital city. 

Sutrisna owns a small stall that sells mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments for his customers. Sutrisna joined Ruma because he wants to earn more income by selling mobile phone airtime credits. He also thinks that Ruma's business is innovative and he wants to gain more knowledge from it. 

As his business continues, he needs a working capital loan from Kiva to process more transactions especially on weekends when more people tend to  come to his stall. For the last three months, he has had around $50 in sales per day just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. He's glad that his business is assisted and supported by Ruma agents. In the photo, Sutrisna is sitting in his stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, blocks, iron and a toilet.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es: El comité Santa Lucia se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Cada una de ellas tiene sus actividades diferentes.  La Sra. Teresa es macatera (vendedora ambulante) y pide este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de canastas que en estas fiestas va adornar y vender en su comunidad, así también agradece por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de poder crecer y salir adelante en cada emprendimiento que todas hacen.
texts.en: The Santa Lucia committee was formed by residents from the city of Santaní.  Each one of them have different businesses.  Teresa is a mobile merchant and is asking for this loan to buy baskets that she will decorate and sell for these festivals in her community.  She is grateful for the opportunity that they are all receiving so they can grow and get ahead in each of their businesses.

loans.use: to buy baskets..

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 41 years of age, used his previous loan to buy a welding machine. He also bought vehicle and motorcycle spare parts for use in his mechanic business. It was profitable, and he repaid the loan successfully. 

He was able to achieve his hopes of opening a spare-parts shop, which he is now running, and he plans to use this loan to buy more stock of spare parts for resale. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

Stephen hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Pashalina

texts.en:
Pashalina has a grocery store in Kangundo town. She sells vegetables, fruit and potatoes and also does farming. She is 49 years old, married and together with her spouse she has been blessed with four children. She has been in this business for two years and it has been profitable.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of vegetables, onions, tomatoes, carrots and potatoes for resale. This will enable her to meet her customers' needs as well as make more profits which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

This is her third loan and she repaid her previous loans successfully. In future Pashalina hopes to expand her business by opening another grocery store.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, potatoes, and fruit.

loans.name: Mbeneka

texts.en:
Mbeneka is 46 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with four children. She does farming in Kangundo town and her spouse who is a vegetable farmer also provides addition income. She has been in this business for 12 years.

She will use this loan to buy a generator which she will use to pump water for irrigation in her farm. She will also buy fertilizer. She will use the anticipated profits to start a grocery business.

This is her third loan and she repaid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to buy a motorcycle to use for supplying her farm produce to other markets in the area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a generator to pump water for irrigation

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Due to financial hardships, Edith aims to improve her small retail store to increase her income. She is 27 and still single. She plans to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demand, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more inventory of soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, beverages, laundry soaps, and seasonings to sell. She is hoping that her loan will be granted to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, beverages, laundry soaps and seasonings to sell

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Catalina Lucy

texts.es:
Catalina Lucy tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes con más de 12 años de experiencia, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Catalina Lucy is 35 years old and she lives with her family in the Oyotún district. Her community is located two hours away from the town of Chiclayo, on the Peruvian northern coast, and they engage in agriculture, trading and animal breeding.

She breeds and sells animals such as ducks, roosters, hens and “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig), She has an experience of more than 12 years in the field, and her activity is located in her house. She is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN to buy animal feed to fatten her animals, in order to sell them to her customers, thus earning a better income for her family.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her animals.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn dreams to be a rice dealer next year and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus sells goats and sheep in Kangundo town. He has been in this business for the last four years. He is 40 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with three children. 

He will use this loan to buy more goats and sheep to resell. He will use the generated profits to educate his children. 

This is his first loan term. His future hopes are to be a successful businessman and to educate his children to university level.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep to resell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 52 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Flora has been raising cattle for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Flora is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her cattle.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 64 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Genara has a sewing business in the Philippines. Genara requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, buttons, etc., for her business.

Genara has been in this business for six years. In the future, Genara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, buttons, etc., for her business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora works hard to support her family. Flora is married and has a business buying and selling coconuts in the Philippines.

Flora requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Flora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kulushay

texts.ru: Кулушай 58 лет, пенсионерка, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 3 детей. Все дети проживают отдельно и самостоятельно. С Кулушай проживает внук. У Кулушай - среднее образование, она оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Кулушай знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Кулушай в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулушай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 теленка и 14 овец. Для содержания скота имеются все условия: сарай для содержания скота, отгонные пастбища. Дойных коров содержит круглогодично дома, присматривают сами, а овец с марта по октябрь месяцы ежегодно выгоняет на пастбища чабану. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулушай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулушай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство незавершенного дома.
texts.en:
Kulushay is 58 years old and she is retired.  She is married and has raised three children with her husband.  All of her children live on their own, and one grandson lives with her.  Kulushay has a high school education and her outlook on life is optimistic.  She knows exactly what she wants and she goes after it with all her strength.  She knows how to use and budget money to reach her goals.  

As the main source of income for her family, Kulushay works raising livestock.  She started this business 23 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, she now has two dairy cows, three calves and 14 sheep.  She has everything she needs to keep the animals, including a barn and a pasture for roaming.  Her dairy cows spend all year on the farm and Kulushay looks after them herself, and the sheep are tended by a shepherd from March to October while they roam in the pasture.  She has enough hay and feed to provide for the animals.  Her monthly income is 7,000 som (KGS).  

With the goal of developing her business further, Kulushay has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy calves so she can increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use the money from the loan to further increase her head of livestock, as well as to save up money to finish some building work in progress on her home.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil and meat for her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 28-year-old married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. 

He is a farmer but also deals in produce sales in order to raise money to support his family. With the proceeds he has been able to buy a motorcycle to help him in transportation of his goods from other farmers to the different markets. Like most traders in this business, he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and bad roads that become impassable during the rainy season. His dream is to set up a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round.

Richard intends to use the loan to buy beans, maize and cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Karkyra

texts.ru: Каркыре 31 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Каркыры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Каркыра занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Каркыры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также имеется 0,20 ГА арендованной земли на которой она выращивает перец, фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Каркыра обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку бычков. Каркыра закупает бычков, откармливает 2 месяца, а на 3 месяце реализовывает  на рынке по высокой цене.  Доходы от кредита Каркыра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники.
texts.en: Karkyra is 31 years old and she is married with three children.  She has a high school education and she raises livestock, which is the main source of income for her family.  She started six years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Karkyra now has two dairy cows, as well as a .2 hectare plot of land on which she grows peppers, beans and clover.  Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Karkyra has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy bulls.  She will buy the bulls, fatten them up for two months and on the third month she will sell them at a profit at the local market.  She plans to use the income from this to further increase her head of livestock, as well as to save up money to buy some appliances for her home.

loans.use: to buy steers to fatten and resell

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 44 years old, married, and has two children. He looks after his retired mother as well. Tamaz own a vans and works in the transportation business. He carries and transports a variety of goods, depending on the needs and requests of his customers. Tamaz is the only breadwinner in his household.
