Several days ago, his van was damaged and Tamaz is unable to continue working. He is requesting a loan to pay the local auto repair shop to fix his van. He will carry on with his business and generate income. Tamaz and his family members are waiting for your support.

loans.use: to fix his van and continue working in transportation

loans.name: Zebedi

texts.en:
Zebedi is 38 years old and lives in the village of Guturi with his wife, two children, parents and a brother. The family runs an agricultural business and raises two milk cows and two calves. He takes good care of his livestock and sells the received milk locally. 

As well, Zebedi grows maize and nut trees on his own plot of land. In his free time, he serves the local people as a taxi driver and gets additional income.

His existing funds are not enough for a family of seven. With this start-up loan, Zebedi will purchase a truck and will work in a transportation business. He will carry and transport a variety of goods, depending on the needs and requests of his customers. For this season, Zebedi will transport firewood from the forest and get a service fee. As he has the appropriate experience in this field, Zebedi hopes his project will be successful and lucrative. Zebedi would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Originally from the Kampong Speu province, Sophal is 33 and a mother of five kids. She is a local farmer who not only grows paddy rice as the main source of income but also has a rice trading business - she buys for stock and resales for a higher price. She has been engaged in her current business for ages. Sophal is quite new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Besides the income generating activity that she needs to take care of, she needs to focus on her child’s education too, especially her son who wants to become a nurse. She will use her entire loan portion to cover the school fee for her son for his associate bachelor degree. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To cover the school fee for her son for his associate bachelor degree

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex, whose previous loan was funded by Kiva lenders, manured his coffee garden which increased his productivity and he repaid his loan well. All of his children are in school. Alongside coffee growing, Alex, has started brewing local wine to supplement their income and because of the increase in demand for the wine. His customers are villagers who cannot afford the price of beer and therefore opt for the local brew which is cheaper. 

Alex has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 in order to purchase more raw materials to help him in his brewing business. He also plans to construct a permanent house for his children in the near future. Alex is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy bananas for brewing local wine

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en:
Rat is a mother in her late 20s residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, where her dry season paddy rice grows. To earn additional income, she works for others for a fee, and she can earn up to 37,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the original loan for Rat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid with success, enabled her uplift her living condition better than before. 

Now, she has formed a group of two to get a new loan and she is the leader. For this cycle, she is seeking 600,000 KHR, while her co-borrower is applying for 400,000 KHR. Rat will spend her entire loan portion to buy five sacks of fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can boost her crop timely with a good yield in return.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is 42-years-old and a mother of four children who resides in the Kampong Thom province. The main sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and her husband's occupation as a government officer as an assistant to the village chief.  The business that she has had for ages has enabled her to maintain a good living condition for her family. This is an original loan for Rey with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this cycle, she is seeking an education loan in order to cover the school fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in nursing. She hopes that she can fulfill her daughter's dream so that her daughter can get a good job.

loans.use: To cover the school fee for her daughter

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sor is 32 years old and has three dependent children who are still in school. Like many in  her neighborhood, she grows the popular crop, cassava, as a single source of income. This is the business that she has had for 14 years. 

Sor is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has used her past loan, which she has repaid completely, wisely to cover the demands of her business and receive a decent income in return as well as to keep her children in school. 

For this cycle, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Sor will spend her entire loan portion to pay the reaping fee, the plowing fee, and to buy fertilizer plus insecticide for her crop. She strongly believes that she will get a good income from her crop.

loans.use: To pay the reaping fee, the plowing fee, and to buy fertilizer plus insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband, Batmunh, runs a small, traditional, leather-shoe manufacturing business at home. Her older daughter attends dance and music college and her younger son studies at a local school. 

Altantsetseg moved to the province center in 2008 with her family and started working as saleswoman in a local grocery store. Her husband started manufacturing shoes as a business at home soon after they moved into the province center. Altantsetseg helps her husband during her spare time to meet customer orders on time. They are very hardworking, passionate and diligent people who already have established their good names with their good service and qualified products. 

Altantsetseg is now requesting loan of 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase inventory for her family business of manufacturing shoes at home.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her family business of manufacturing shoes at home

loans.name: Latofat

texts.en:
Latofat was born in 1957. She is a widow. Latofat has three children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 15 years. Latofat’s business is the main source of income because her children have little income. Latofat’s husband died 10 years ago. Since her husband died, she manages with the business alone. 

Latofat feeds cattle at her house where she has a big cowshed. Latofat feeds cattle for four or five months. She is going to increase her working capital and with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 9,000 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira is a married parent of 3 children. Her husband is a migrant. That’s why she has been busy with up-bringing her children alone. 

Mohira has her own business. She sells women's national dresses. Mohira sells clothes in a local market. Mohira always tries to develop her business. 

Mohira is asking for a loan of 2,500 USD to buy women's clothes for increasing working capital. This loan will help her to develop business further and maximize profit. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda is a young and ambitious woman. She was born in 1990. She is divorced. Mavluda has no children. She lives with her parents. 

Mavluda has a higher pedagogical degree. She works in a school as a teacher. She is smart teacher and always tries to improve her knowledge. She has a small salary. Mavluda wants to buy a TV set because she needs a TV set. She does not have enough money and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy a TV set. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a TV set for her household.

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.en:
Gulsunoy was born in 1958. She is widow and has a child. 

Gulsunoy has worked more than 12 years in a school. She is a nurse. Gulsunoy lives poorly with her child because she has a small salary. Gulsunoy is ill. She must to go to a doctor for treatment but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 3,300 TJS to buy medicine for treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine for treatment.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, with nine children.

To earn a living, Elizabeth has a business in which she sells a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. Elizabeth has a requested a loan for additional capital.

Elizabeth has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for one year. In the future, Elizabeth would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw foods to cook and sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is operating a tricycle transportation business while also working as a security guard. He has been providing the transportation services for more than six years and he earns well from this. He successfully repaid his previous loan used in repairing his tricycle. Edward took a new loan recently to buy new tires and waterproof leather. He plans to purchase an additional tricycle unit to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and waterproof leather.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
To make a living, Henry is operating a motor transportation service in his community. He has been doing this for many years as his main source of income. He earns well from this in order to provide for the family, and had successfully repaid his previous loan used for motor maintenance costs. 

Currently, he took a new loan to buy a new set of tires. He plans to save a portion of his generated income to acquire another motorcycle for expanding his business. He wants to improve the general living conditions of his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires.

loans.name: Sashik

texts.en:
Sashik, 21, lives with his parents in Goris town. Despite his young age, he has been keeping animals for five years. Sashik keeps 80 sheep and 10 chickens. Livestock breeding is the only source of the family's income. Realizing this, Sashik has applied for this loan to be able to increase the number of sheep by 20. The loan is important for this young farmer and his family as it's a good opportunity to continue their livestock breeding activities. 

As this is Sashik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for 20 sheep.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Musaler village in the Ejmiatsin region. She lives there with her husband and two little kids. Anna's husband works at a local company and Anna herself is involved in farming. She keeps a small livestock of 5 cows and 14 chickens. The income that Anna gets from agribusiness helps her and her husband to cover their basic daily costs. By applying for this loan, Anna would like to increase the livestock by 2 oxen and also purchase forage for feeding her animals. Anna will be very grateful to lenders for their support, and the loan will assist her in enlarging the farm. 
As this is Anna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for 2 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Goga

texts.en:
Goga is a 22-year-old married man from Kutaisi city. He lives with his just-married wife, who is a housekeeper. Goga is involved in a distribution business. He works at a private company and monthly generates 400 GEL (Georgia lari). 

In order to more efficiently meet all daily costs, Goga wants to start his own private activity. He requested a loan from Credo. The start-up program helps people like Goga to get a chance for starting or restarting businesses. His requested loan was approved for $1,600 USD for purchasing used car parts and start trading in them. This new business will give him financial stability and better living conditions for his newly created family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To start a used car parts business

loans.name: Shehzadi

texts.en:
Shehzadi is 33 years old, a married woman and a mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires replacement of some important spare parts and the body. However, due to lack of availability of funds, he is unable to buy spare parts and replace the rickshaw’s body. 

For this reason, Shehzadi has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new spare parts and a new body for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Shehzadi thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and replace the rickshaw's body.

loans.name: Eti

texts.en:
Meet Eti. She is a housewife who has a child. They live in the family home in Cibubur, a suburban area located about 30 minutes from Jakarta. 

To support her family's needs, Eti runs a small stall where she sells mobile phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits, and services bill payments for her customers. She joined Ruma because she wants to improve her business. She is glad that her business received assistance and support from Ruma agents. 

For the last three months, she has got around $61 per day in sales on average just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends when more people tend to come to her stall. In the future, she is planning to seek more business opportunities. In the photo, Eti is standing in front of her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Radhakrushna Sss Group

texts.en:
The women of the Radhakrushna SSS are from a small village in Odisha in the eastern part of the India. The group is composed of eight women who earn their living by raising animals like cattle and chickens, selling milk, and cultivating and selling vegetables. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan with People's Forum. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new year with solid goals and dreams.

Urmila is a 51-year-old married mother of one daughter. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Urmila. She completed three years of formal education but due to the poor economic condition of her family, had to leave her education behind. Along with all the clients of People's Forum, Urmila realizes that education is a vital key to a successful future for her child. She says that her business is running quite well and, because of its success, she will be able to register her child in a good school this year. Her husband shares the same goals for the child. 

Urmila is engaged in vegetable cultivation and she produces potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and seasonal vegetables. She is applying for her first loan with People's Forum. The requested funds will be used to purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation. With an optimistic spirit and positive attitude, Urmila looks forward to this new year with its challenges, blessings and successes.

On behalf of her colleagues, Urmila expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support. In addition, the ladies send greetings to all for a happy, healthy and successful new year!

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Three Girls Group

texts.en:
Rosalina is the featured borrower of the Three Girls group. She got a long with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to support their beloved families back in the Philippines.

Rosalina is a 55-year-old married mother of six children. She works as a housekeeper to support them as much as she could. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to send it to her family to buy necessary needs such as clothes and many other living needs to make sure that her precious family will be capable of spending a delightful Christmas spirit.

Rosalina is the second lady from the left side with a black top and white spots. As for the other group members, Lielyn is the first from the left, Catherine is the second from the right, and Erlinda is the first from the right.

loans.use: to send it to her family to buy necessary needs such as clothes and many other living needs to make sure that her precious family will be capable of spending a delightful Christmas spirit.

loans.name: Africa One Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 30s, is married and has a boy who is in school. For two years now, Halima has been managing her family by running a clothing business. She works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is Halima's first loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy new inventory of clothes to resell to more people. She is really doing great and dreams to improve her enterprise more. Halima will share this loan with her loan group Africa One, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to resell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 70 years old. She  is a widow and has three adult children. She lives in Sinian Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.   Elena has engaged in the rice farming business for 30 years, earning a monthly income of 4000 PHP. Elena requested a new loan to pay for labor in the rice field doing plowing, etc., and to buy fertilizers. Elena is a good member of Paglaum MPC, hoping to save more  out of her income.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy two sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Fatin

texts.en:
Fatin is 44 years old. She lives with her husband in Alshata’ camp in Gaza. It is a Palestinian refugee camp located west of the city of Gaza on the shore of the Sea of Gaza, and this is called the beach camp. She is working on her home embroidery work, and her husband works in the public sector, which has low salaries. 

Fatin applied for Ryada for a loan to paint her house and build doors and windows, which will help to warm her house, especially now in the winter. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to paint her house and build doors and windows, which will help to warm her house, especially now in the winter.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 19- year-old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Islam's brother works in the public sector as an employee and he gets a low income. Islam studies Islamic origins and he would like to finish his study and take the BA degree and then find a job.

Islam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help to pay the university installment for this semester. By taking this loan, Islam will be able to complete his study and find a job as soon as possible.
 
Islam appears in the photo in front of his collage

loans.use: to pay the university installment for this semester.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old. She is married and has two high school students. She lives in Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. Gemma has engaged in rice farming as a business for 20 years, earning a monthly income of 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). Her husband is also a farmer; they own a small parcel of land to work on as the source of their income. 

Gemma requested a new loan to buy three head of pigs to raise as another means to pay for her children's tuition. She is striving for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy an additional three head of pigs to raise

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza is 66 years old. She is married and has two adult children. She lives in Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. Riza has engaged in a livestock business, selling pigs and chickens. Her husband is also a farmer. They are striving for their future as they grow old. She applied for a loan to buy two sacks of pig feeds. Riza wants to save more for her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of pig feeds

loans.name: Elefina

texts.es:
Elefina tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, pollos, patos, cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio; también brinda servicio de labores agrícolas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elefina is 55 years old and she lives with her family in the Oyotún district. Her community is located two hours away from the town of Chiclayo, on the Peruvian northern coast, and they engage in agriculture, trading and animal breeding.


She breeds and sells pultry, ducks and “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig), and her activity is located in her house; she also offer agricultural services. She is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN to buy animal feed to fatten her animals, in order to sell them to her customers, thus earning a better income for her family.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her animals.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is 52 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with eight children. Five among them are grown-ups, working and now independent. She does farming in Kangundo town where she keeps dairy cattle as well as planting cash crops. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She will use this loan to buy cow feed, fertilizer and insecticides for spraying her crops. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her younger children and improve the living standards of her family. 

This is her third loan, having paid all her previous loans successfully. In future Terry hopes be successful in her farming business and be able to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy insecticides, fertilizer and cow feed.

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
Genevie is a married woman with six children, five of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Genevie is 28 years old.

Genevie has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. Genevie requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers.

Genevie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Genevie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gelma

texts.en:
Gelma, 36, is a married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gelma has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Gelma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

In the future, Gelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Felicite

texts.en: Felicite is aged 40. She is married with six children. She sells beans and has spent 18 years in the business. She wants to use the loan for adding more beans for sale. With the profits from the business, she will expand her business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old and married with two children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, cooking oil, diapers, etc., to sell in her general store.

Gina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Gina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, cooking oil, diapers, etc., to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. Gemma has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from selling vegetables and spices.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Madrine

texts.en:
Madrine is a 38-year-old woman who deals in second-hand clothes. She used the previous loan to buy bedding to sell. 

She has run this business for a period of nine years. She started with agriculture and, after a good sale of the harvest, she ventured into the cloth retailing business. She says inadequate capital and high taxes are affecting her business while her dreams are to buy a car and expand her business to new markets. Madrine is requesting a loan to buy bed sheets and bed covers to sell.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of scrap materials business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell for her buying and selling of scrap materials business.

Guillerma has been in this business for 11 years. Guillerma earns more income from raising livestock.

Guillerma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en: Fortunee is 29 years old. She is married with one child. She sells bananas and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more bananas for sale. She would like to use the profits for reinvesting in the same business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more powdered milk by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Bardhi

texts.en: Bardhi repaired the little family house last winter thanks to lenders' help and now he needs their help again to stock up on second-hand inventory items to resell.  In the meantime, Bardhi wants to wish Happy Holidays to all.  :)

loans.use: To stock up on second-hand inventory items to resell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a Cameroonian aged forty-one, married with four children. The oldest is seventeen and in secondary school while the youngest is seven and in primary school. She has been in this business for over two years which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase her profit by fifteen percent and her standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: to buy wood in logs to split and sell

loans.name: Vannara's Group

texts.en:
Vannara is 44 years old and one breadwinner in her family consisting of three kids. She strives for a living via rice farming and trading and has been in this business for the past 10 years. Vannara is in her sixth loan cycle with the Kiva partner VisionFund. She has repaid her past loans and improved her living condition better than before. 

Vannara is the leader of a micro loan group comprised of three female borrowers who are requesting a total loan of 3,800,000 KHR. She will use her 1,400,000 KHR portion of the loan to pay reaping fees. Vannara highly believes that she can gain a good yield and income with her loan.

loans.use: to pay reaping fees

loans.name: Sokneng

texts.en:
Sokneng is a young mother with three children who is a resident from Cheung Prey district in Kompong Cham province. She is a farmer who does paddy rice cropping in a one-hectare area and who also raises pigs. This is the main source of her family’s income and Sokneng’s current business earns about 55,000 KHR each day. This will be her first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund.

Sokneng is the leader of a group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy more piglets to raise and more pig feed. Sokneng hopes that she can raise her piglets healthily so that she can get a good selling price with a high income in return.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San, aged 39, is a citizen from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children. Her main sources of income are from rice farming and working for others for a fee. She is able to generate about 27,000 KHR per day. 

San is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success and it has enabled her to improve her livelihood so that she can buy more household appliances for her family. 

This is the second loan for San and the first loan for her co-borrower. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for leasing the reaping machine for her paddy rice. She hopes that she can collect her yield on time with a good selling price.

loans.use: To pay for leasing the reaping machine for her paddy rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Maa Vairabi Shg Group

texts.en:
The women pictured here are united into Maa Vairabi Shg. They support each other in their businesses and encourage group savings so they can help themselves through difficult times and improve their lives.

They are now requesting a loan of 165,000 INR to use for their small businesses, including agriculture, cattle, and small shops they own. 

The featured borrower of this group is Sanjulata, who is raising her hand on the far right in the picture. She runs a candle-making business, supplying candles to families for religious purposes and to the shops and households in her village that do not have access to reliable electricity. Her husband works with her in the business, and they support their two young-adult children and her husband’s mother, who all still live with them.

Sanjulata has been doing the candle business for five years now and is planning to use her portion of the group loan to buy a new machine to help with the candle making and to purchase more materials in bulk, because that way they are cheaper and she can earn a higher profit. She enjoys her work and hopes to build up to a big candle factory so she can support herself and her family in a high quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new machine to help with the candle making and to purchase more materials in bulk for her candle-making business.

loans.name: Jay Ganesh Shg Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group loan will be used by Sabita, who runs a lighting business in her small village where she lives with her husband and three daughters in Odisha, a state on the Eastern Coast of India. She is pictured here on the extreme right of the photo. For 18 years, she and her husband have been running the business together. They have had trouble accessing financing and still don't have a building to host the store, so they sell their goods either on a cloth in the market, or door-to-door in the village, and keep the extra goods at their house.

With this loan, Sabita will buy more light bulbs in bulk because they are cheaper and expand the business. Together, she and her husband will be able to increase their savings and buy a proper shop in the near future. In the meantime, she also hopes to use the profits to help her daughters get a good education and become strong, independent women. 

The other women in Jay Ganesh SHG group are using their loans for small shops and cattle farming in Sabita's village.

loans.use: To buy more light bulbs to sell

loans.name: Sari Indah Badung Group

texts.en:
The Sari Indah Badung Group got a 25,000,000 IDR loan from MUK and the group paid off all of the loan on time. With 10 members still, the group decided to continue borrowing new loans to improve their businesses.

Ni Nyoman, as the head of the group, sold 3 of her pigs for 3,500,000 IDR, and she still has one left to sell later. After deducting all the costs, she earned a profit of 1,000,000 IDR. She feels so happy because all of her hard work, after maintaining the pigs for 5 months, gets a good result. She uses the profit she earns for daily needs and for saving for her family's future needs.

With no change in the number of members or loan size, when the Sari Indah Badung Group receives their new loan of 25,000,000 IDR, each member will receive 2,500,000 IDR. This loan is focused on purchasing superior piglets and feed for them.

With her loan, Ni Nyoman purchased 2 superior piglets for fattening and used the rest for feed. To reduce the cost, Ni Nyoman combines feeds to make a mixture feed. She hopes that in the next 5 months the progress of pig growth will be fast and she can sell at a high price. Her husband helps her business by providing traditional feed every day, such as banana leaf from his garden. With this business, Ni Nyoman hopes she can save her profits to renovate her kitchen.

loans.use: To buy 2 superior piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Uhuru Group

texts.en:
Zakia, who is in her early 30s, is single with three children, two of whom are in school, while another is grown up. 

For a period of two years now, Zakia has been managing her family by running a mamalishe business. She works from 6pm to 11pm per working day, just five hours of working. Zakia is able to make a fair monthly return.

This is Zakia's fourth loan request to Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy food supplies from her store, like cooking oil, rice, beans, baking flour, and maize flour. She has successfully paid back all of her previous loans. Zakia used her business profit to cover school fees and household expenses. 

Zakia will use this loan to buy food supplies, like stocks of rice, beans, baking flour, maize flour, and cooking oil. She dreams to open a business place where she can sell her food.

Zakia will share this loan with her loan group, Uhuru Group, which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food supplies, like stocks of rice, beans, baking flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gulnasab

texts.en:
Gulnasab is hardworking, successful and smart woman. She was born in 1986. She is married and has three children. 

Gulnasab is the main caretaker of her children because her husband is a migrant. Gulnasab sells vegetables in a local market. She has been busy with this business more than five years. Gulnasab has her regular customers. She is one of the successful business ladies in the local market. 

She is going to organize a party in her family but she has not enough money. She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to organize a party. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To organize a party.

loans.name: Hannibal

texts.en: Hannibal plants and harvests rice crops for sale. He is 43 years old. He aims to strengthen his business to earn a higher income and be able to continue to send his four children to school. He plans to sustain his crops with complete farm inputs but he had insufficient funds. For this reason, Hannibal is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides. He knows that application of necessary farm inputs to his farmland will enable him to obtain plentiful yields this next harvest season. He hopes that someday he will improve his living conditions and that his four children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Joval

texts.en:
Joval is 33 years old, married, and has three lovely children. They live in the peaceful village of Bantug Petines, in the town of Alicia.

To earn for living, Joval is engaged in a hog-raising business. He has been running his hog-raising business for almost five years. He usually earns a net income of PHP 2,500 per piglet. The income gained from his hog raising business goes toward their daily consumption and allowances of his children.

Joval is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase feed and vaccines of his hogs. He knows that he could keep his hogs healthy and free from diseases because of the sustenance of nutritious hog feed and vaccines. 

He is hoping that lenders will continue to sustain his financial needs, allowing him to obtain greater income.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for the maintenance and proper growth of his hogs.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian has been operating her own retail store in her village to make a living. For eleven years of the business, Lilian has earned well for the family and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used as capital for the business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. She is determined to provide a better living for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Orland

texts.en:
Orland is a single entrepreneur who operates a service-based business while working in a private company to make a living.

He installed the motorcycle and is able to provide transportation in his locality. He borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to pay off the vehicle. He is hopeful to gain more income with his business and plans to acquire more units for business expansion.

loans.use: to pay off the motorcycle.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando grows and harvests rice as his family's main source of income to make a living. While awaiting the harvest, he also earns income from his motor transport services. He earns well from this and was able to successfully repay his previous loan from GDMPC, which was used for motor repair. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC to buy new tires for the vehicle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated for house renovations.

loans.use: to buy new tires for the vehicle.

loans.name: Makimbilio Ii Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Dombo est une commerçante d’une expérience de 15 ans, âgée de 42 ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants qui tous, étudient. La cliente est membre d’un groupe d’Affaires « Makimblio II ». Elle est vendeuse du lait frais. Elle installe sa marchandise dans l’avenue mouvementée de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 100 litres de lait. Elle démarra ses affaires  dans son jeune âge, avec le fonds reçu de ses parents. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment de post conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Dombo is a trader with fifteen years' experience.  She is forty-two years old, widowed and has four children.  All her children attend school.  She is a member of the business group 'Makimblio II'.

Dombo sells fresh milk on a busy street in her town.  She started her business at a young age, using money provided by her parents.

She has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business, and will use the loan to buy 100 litres of milk.

In the future, Dombo would like to increase her loans, and feed and educate her children.

She is grateful to Hekima for the micro loans they provide to non-bankable, women entrepreneurs.  This is particularly important during the post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 100 litres of milk for resale.

loans.name: Makimblio I Group

texts.fr: La cliente Fazila est une commerçante depuis 7 ans, vice présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Makimbilio I », âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de7 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse souliers usagés. Elle installe ses business dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de l'IMF Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 70 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un technicien automobiliste (Mécanicien). Elle débuta son activité avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout; pendant, la période poste conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
Fazila has been a trader for seven years, and is Vice-President of the business group 'Makimbilio I'.  She is forty years old, married and has seven children.  All her children attend school.  

Fazila sells second-hand shoes at the main market in her town.  Her husband is a car mechanic, and she started her business with money that he provided.

Fazila has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business.  With the loan, she will buy 70 pairs of shoes.

In the future, Fazila would like to buy a plot of building land, and feed and educate her children.

She is grateful to Hekima for targetting women entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the traditional banking system, by offering them loans without the need for a guarantee.  This is particularly important during the post conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 70 pairs of second-hand shoes for resale.

loans.name: Simplicio

texts.en:
To make a living, Simplicio is earning from his farm of corn. He has been in the farm business for 15 years and he earns well from this to provide for the needs of the family. 

He had expand his corn production business and, without hesitation, he borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy organic fertilizer. 

Simplicio was determined enough to provide the family with a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Linety

texts.en:
Linety is a 30-year-old farmer and a proud mother of 3 children, all of whom are of school-going age. They live in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya. She has been working in agriculture for 10 years as it is her main source of livelihood, and she produces and sells milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She enjoys poultry farming and selling the poultry products in the market, but her major challenge is poultry diseases.
Linety chose Juhudi Kilimo because she heard that they offer short term loans to farmers and she wanted to add more poultry to her farm. During the training offered, she learnt how to develop a culture of saving. The use of this loan will produce more income which will enable her to pay the school fees for her children and to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Maa Pandabasuni Shg (A) Group

texts.en:
Maa Pandabasuni Shg Self Help Group is made up of nine women from a small village of Odisha, India. All the members of this group are involved in  activities such as vegetable cultivation, milk selling, paddy and maize cultivation, etc. They are very hardworking women with a willingness to learn new business trends.They all help and support each other. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses.

One of the group members, Jamuna, is the president of this group. The lady standing with hand raised is Jamuna.

Jamuna is 35 years old and lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two children, age 8 years and 5 years. She does vegetable cultivation. She produces vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflowers, brinjals, lady fingers, onions, etc. and sells them at the market. Her husband is a farmer. Her husband helps Jamuna in vegetable selling at the market. Jamuna is planning to buy standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides so she can produce more vegetables and can increase her income.

Jamuna, along with her group members, is asking for a loan amount of 135,000 INR to invest in their business activities. Jamuna will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation.

She wants to construct a house for her family. She says, on the behalf of the group members, "Thank you, Kiva, for providing this opportunity for us!"

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her vegetable growing.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 35-year-old married woman. She has three children, two daughters and a son. She is striving hard to support them, which includes providing food and healthcare. Her husband is employed in a small factory, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family.
 
Shumaila started her business sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She requested a loan to buy some spools of thread, cloth, buttons and needles so she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without failure. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread, cloth, buttons, and packs of zippers and needles.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna, aged, 32, is a responsible mother. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap goods such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, waste papers, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells them to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have enough to buy scrap goods and does not have a stock of scrap to sell for getting money. Therefore, Lubna requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 

Lubna is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods for resale.

loans.name: Chimbuko Group

texts.en:
Muhibu, who is a single man in his mid-30s, has two children who are in school. 

For six years now, Muhibu has had a business selling shoes for men, women and children. He normally runs his shop from 7:30 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his 17th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Muhibu paid back his previous loans fully, and he purchased more business stocks, especially ladies' shoes, for his shop. With his business profit, he covered school fees, family food and medical expenses. Muhibu also bought a plot of land. 

With this loan, he will buy new shoes to resell in his shop. Muhibu hopes to build a house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Chimbuko," which totals five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new shoes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a truck body.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian is a 33-year-old lady who is a single mother with one child. For the past five years, she has sold belts, caps, and other items in Kangemi. Lillian earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES. 

Lillian is requesting a loan to buy new stock of belts, caps and other items. This will be her second loan with KADET LTD. In the future, Lillian wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy belts, caps, and other items

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of beef, chicken and pork to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells different vegetables and rents out an apartment for additional income.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to pay for beef, chicken and pork needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Delia dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beef, chicken and pork to resell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She sells personal products and she and her husband work hard to provide for their family’s everyday needs. Analyn previously accessed a loan and was able to buy more merchandise for her direct selling business which she has operated for seven years now. Her loan was also big help for the education of her children and for her family’s personal, household and business expenditures. 

Analyn is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better, as more items to sell will result in better profit. Analyn’s business profits will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and provide for their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. In the future, Analyn hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up weekly with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more merchandise and products to sell

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
This is Aiza. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy different products such as wallets, belts, chargers, and other items needed in her business. Aiza’s earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for her family’s personal, household and business expenditures.

Aiza is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy different products such as wallets, belts, chargers and other items needed in her business. The more items displayed at her store the better as more items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from Aiza’s loan will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. In the future, Aiza dreams that her business will be more flourishing and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy wallets, belts, chargers and other items needed in her business

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is 31 years old. She is married and has four children. 

She sells various merchandise in her boutique and has spent five years in the business. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more boutique items such as sugar, rice, lotions and biscuits for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, and lotions for sale.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is an Iraqi youth client who is 28-years-old and married with no children. Hasan lives with his family of three, including one who helps Hasan to provide the family income.

Hasan owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2006 and now he has hired an employee. He has built up experience in this field and is becoming well known with an excellent reputation in the surrounding area. 

Hasan is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 (USD) in order to buy a new refrigerator, a new freezer and more goods to sell. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator, a new freezer and more goods to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Imelda is 50 years old and her children are in school.

Imelda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Imelda has been in this business for 1 year. Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. 

Isabel is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell for her buy and sell firewood business. Isabel has been in this business for 9 years. Isabel earns additional income from a general store.

Isabel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 30 años de edad, esta a acompañado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos legítimos. José es sastre, y a su corta edad a fundado una pequeña empresa de corte y confección.

Tiene 10 años de experiencia trabajando en este oficio, aprendió en asistiendo a talleres de empresas que se dedican a esta actividad. Trabaja por contrato, tiene 6 contratos con el gobierno para la elaboración de uniformes, además emplea 2 personas.

El préstamo será utilizado para pagar una cirugía de su padre, la construcción de una pila para recolectar agua y para pagar el aguinaldo a sus dos empleados.

En un  futuro espera comprar un vehículo, así poder movilizarse con sus uniformes y no entregarlos tan maltratados.
texts.en:
José, 30, has a common-law wife and three children, two of them his own.

José's a tailor and has already established a small tailoring business.  He learned by helping in businesses devoted to this work and has 10 years of experience in the field.  He works on contract and has six contracts with the government to make uniforms.  He also employs two people.

He'll use the loan to pay for surgery for his father, to build barrels to collect water, and to give bonuses to his employees. 

José hopes to buy a vehicle in the future so he'll be able to get around with his uniforms and not have to deliver them so battered.

loans.use: to pay for surgery for his father, to build barrels to collect water, and to give bonuses to his employees

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Isabel is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock. Isabel has been raising livestock for 11 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

Isabel is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Helen requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

texts.en: Kishwar is 40 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her husbands is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning. For this her husband, Kishwar has applied for a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. He wants to fix his rickshaw and wants to buy new spare parts for his vehicle. Kishwar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of a rickshaw.

loans.name: Jahania Self Help Group

texts.en:
Gulasan is a member of Jahania Self Help Group and is pictured here (with her hand raised). She is planning to use her loan to help grow her brick business by purchasing items like coal and sand and a better machine that will improve the quality and quantity of the bricks she produces. She is in this business with her husband, and it is her family’s main source of income to support their two young boys, ages 5 and 7 years. 

They live in a joint family with her husband’s father, mother, brother, and his brother’s family, and her husband’s elderly parents are also dependent on their income.
 
Gulasan says, “Now our business will be very good, with the support of the loan. In the future, we want a brick factory built in an even more modernized way.” 

She is proud of the work they do and excited to be taking the loan. She says, “With the continued support of Kiva lenders, I can change my and my family’s life in the long term. Thank you, Kiva!”

The other women in Jahania Self Help Group are using their loans to improve their agriculture, dairy, and other small businesses.

loans.use: to purchase items for her bricks business like coal and sand and a better machine that will improve the quality and quantity of the bricks she produces.

loans.name: Tileneya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe TILENEYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 6ème  prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme   DJELIKA   fait la vente de pommade dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est  1 ère position de la  droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ une quantité importante de pommade et  qu’elle revend en détail sur place et au marché . Elle vend au comptant avec une clientèle constituée d’homme et femme. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 francs cfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the 'Tileneya' Group are all married women, around thirty-seven years of age, and with an average of four children.  Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, a busy district in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). 

This will be the sixth loan for the group with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  They will use their loans to help them satisfy the demands of their customers.

Djelika (on the far right of the photo) sells skin cream.  She will use her loan to buy a large quantity of skin cream which she will sell from her home, and at the market.  She sells on a cash basis to both men and women.

Djelika expects to make a monthly average of 25,000 francs CFA, and will use her earnings to repay her loan and interest, and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy skin creams for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es:
Bertila, está solicitando un  nuevo préstamo para comprar productos de belleza tales como labiales, polvos, rubores, sombras, entre otros, con lo que fortalecerá el negocio de venta de productos de belleza y dulces.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a adquirir los productos necesarios para mejorar el servicio que daba a sus clientes, sus ingresos aumentaron, ha cancelado sus deudas y mejorado sus condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Bertila is requesting a new loan to buy beauty products such as lipstick, powder, blush, eyeshadow, etc, with which she will strengthen her business of selling beauty products and sweets.
The previous loan helped her to acquire the products necessary to improve the service that she gave to her customers, her income increased, and she has settled her debts and improved her family conditions.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Srin's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Srin is aged 61 years old and married. She and her husband have two children. To make a living, she and her husband earn a living through farming rice, growing cassava and working for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 18,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Srin has been with VisionFund for one cycle and successfully paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her cassava and use a portion of it to spend on harvesting rice. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Generous

texts.en: Generous is a first time borrower applying for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX. She is married with four children and stays in Entebbe. She has a small retail shop in a trading center which she runs herself. Generous says she has customers from nearby and from those going to the airport. She wants to stock her shop to make it a one-stop shopping center in kitooro-Entebbe. She does not have enough capital and is thus applying for a loan. Generous further says that she has plans for paying the loan fast and plans to apply for other loans to acquire some valuable assets.

loans.use: to buy retail stock of sugar, soap, salt, bread and others things.

loans.name: Phey's Group

texts.en:
Phey is aged 29 years old and married. She is a mother of one daughter. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for several years and supplement their family’s income by working as paid workers. The current business earns her about 18,000 KHR per day to support her family.
 
Phey has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan which has helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes to earn more income from her current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a first-time borrower applying for a loan of one million five hundred thousand shillings (1,500,000). 

He is married with one child and lives in his own home in the city outskirts. He is a motorcycle (bodaboda) rider and stages at Bwaise trading center, which he runs himself. He has been involved for over seven years and has been able to acquire a small plot and put up a residential house. 

John says the business is rewarding and he wants to start investing in a piggery project using small incomes from the motorcycle, but cash at hand is not enough, thus he is applying for a loan to increase the capital to buy the pigs. He is confident this will increase his income and reduce the continuous cash crisis. 

In the photo is John with the Ugafode credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia vive con sus papás, trabaja como enfermera en un hospital de la ciudad de Ybycuí, con lo cual solventa los gastos de estudio. Actualmente está estudiando para recibirse como Licenciada en Enfermería y así mejorar sus conocimientos y por supuesto, sus ingresos. 
Sus padres trabajan en la agricultura, hacen carbón y con sus ingresos le ayudan en lo que pueden.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y en sus gastos de transporte.
texts.en:
Cinthia lives with her parents and works as a nurse in the hospital in Ybycui, through which she pays her education expenses.  She is working on a nursing degree to increase her knowledge and income.

Her parents work as farmers, make charcoal, and help her however then can with their income.  She is asking for a loan to be able to pay tuition and transportation expenses.

loans.use: to pay tuition and transportation.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 41-year-old, married woman who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She is a mother of one child.

Nawal has been selling clothes and Brazilian gold since June 2013, to help her husband with their household expenses and to educate her child. She started her work by selling her products to neighbors and friends, by putting her products in a bag and passing by them, to market her merchandise. Today, she has her own stable shop where she serves her customers in a well-managed way. 

Nawal is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development to increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas collection that will attract customers’ attention and increase her income, which will develop her living. 

She is looking forward to continuing to develop and improve her business in a well-managed way, by increasing her business capital.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas collection.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca tiene una Despensa hace más de 7 años, Es una clienta antigua excelente, una persona trabajadora, inicio su negocio gracias a que Fundación Paraguaya le otorgó un crédito para empezar y sigue hasta hoy en día con su esfuerzo, y además comenta que se dedica a la Costura junto a su hija menor.
Ella hoy pide este crédito a la fundación para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, comestibles, frutas, verduras y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
Francisca has had a grocery store for more than seven years.  She is an excellent client and a hardworking person.  She started her business thanks to the loan that she got from Fundación Paraguaya.  She also says that she does sewing with her daughter.

She is asking for a loan through the foundation so she can buy grocery items such as drinks, food, fruit, vegetables, and other things so she can continue growing an improving daily.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.ru:
Тахмина 35-летняя швея, живет в городе Душанбе. Она очень талантливая и умелая мастерица. Платья, которые она шьет всегда получаются красиво и отличаются оригинальным фасоном. За 7 лет своей деятельности, она приобрела много постоянных клиенток, которые обращаются только к ее услугам. 
Тахмина в данный момент разведена, имеет троих детей, которых сама обеспечивает и воспитывает. Ее детям 16, 15 и 13 лет и они учатся в школе. С ними также живет сестра Тахмины и помогает ей по хозяйству. Сейчас в жизни Тахмины самое дорогое - это ее дети. Она усердно работает ради их светлого будущего. Поэтому Тахмина обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку для развития своего дела.
texts.en:
Takhmina is a 35 years old seamstress, who lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is a very talented and skillful seamstress. The dresses that she sews are always beautiful and have different original styles. Through 7 years in the business, she has gotten many returning customers, who use only her services. 

Takhmina is currently divorced and has three children who she provides for and raises alone. Her children are 16, 15 and 13 years old and go to school. He Takhmina's sister also lives with them, and she helps with the household. Takhmina's children are the most precious thing in her life. She works hard to make a bright future for them. Therefore she applied for a loan to purchase a new sewing machine to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine to develop her sewing business

loans.name: Bakhtibonu

texts.ru: Бахтибону молодая, талантливая девушка в возрасте 25 лет. Она живет  с матерью в городе Душанбе. Бахтибону работает парикмахером-стилистом. Бахтибону открыла свой салон красоты 3 года назад. Она предоставляет такие услуги, как укладка, стрижка, окрашивание волос, шикарные вечерние прически, макияж и т.д. Ее клиентки всегда довольны ею. Бахтибону очень любит свою работу и наслаждается процессом своей работы. Она научилась этому делу у своих подруг и всегда хотела быть парикмахером-стилистом. Сейчас Бахтибону собирается расширить свое дело. Она просит кредит для ремонта салона красоты и приобретения необходимых принадлежностей  для салона.
texts.en: Bakhtibonu is a young, talented 25-year-old woman.  She lives with her mother in the city of Dushanbe.  Bakhtibonu works as a hairdresser and stylist.  She opened her salon three years ago and she offers services like styling, cutting and coloring hair, as well as chic party hair, make-up, etc.  Her clients are always satisfied.  Bakhtibonu loves what she does very much and she enjoys the process of her work.  She learned her trade from friends and she has always wanted to be a hairstylist.  Now she is preparing to expand her business.  She is asking for a loan to make repairs to her salon and to buy some necessary items for the beauty shop.

loans.use: to make repairs to her beauty salon and to buy necessary items for the salon

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 64 years old and married with three children. He lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. For the past three years, Reynaldo has operated a sari-sari (general) store to earn a living. He earns 15,000 PHP each month. Reynaldo is a new member of PMPC who joined in 2013. 

Reynaldo is requesting a 49,900 PHP loan to buy sacks of rice and corn to sell. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and corn

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 49 years old and married. She is blessed with three children. For almost five years, Lilia has been a vegetable vendor in her village. She earns an income of 600 PHP each day and usually spends her profits on school allowances for two of her children. 

Lilia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase string beans, squash, tomatoes, and eggplant to sell. She has previously received loans to boost her business. Lila is hoping that her loan request will be granted so that she can improve her business and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase string beans, squash, tomatoes, and eggplant to sell

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en: Sidi is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be future-oriented and a hardworking woman. She operates a food stall where she sells fish. Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the KES 3150 loan to purchase a cooking charcoal stove. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes in the future to improve the living standard of her family. This is the second loan from SMEP DTM. Previously, she took a loan of KES 20,000 which she paid.

loans.use: to purchase a cooking charcoal stove.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра трудолюбивая женщина. Она разведена и имеет одного сына. Она сама обеспечивает своего сына, так как ее бывший муж не помогает ей по обеспечению сына. После развода, она вернулась в дом родителей и поступила на работу в колхоз. После она стала работать в консервном комбинате. В течение трудовых лет Гулчехра показала себя как честной и порядочной. Она позднее начала свой бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов. Она торгует на местном рынке. Гулчехра хочет купить продукты питания и угля на зиму, но не имеет денег. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a hard working woman. She is divorced and has a son. She is raising him alone, since her past husband is not helping her raise him. After the divorce she returned to her parents house and started working at a collective farm. After that she worked at a canning plant. Throughout her working years Gulchehra proved herself to be honest and decent. She later started her own business selling dried fruit. She sells at the local market. Gulchehra wants to buy food and a coat for winter, but doesn't have the money. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy coal and food product for winter season

loans.name: Sion Group

texts.es:
La señora María esta unida de hecho. De edad 26 años. No le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 1 hijo y no está estudiando. Se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos. Inició este negocio aprendiendo con su madre y a la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para tejer cortes tipicos. En el futuro desea tener mas capital tener un taller para generar fuentes de empleo en su comunidad. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la tejeduría de cortes típicos.
texts.en:
Maria lives in a common-law relationship. She is 26 years old and she did not get the chance to study. She has a child who does not go to school. She engages in waving typical clothes, an activity she learned from her mother and today she can count on 4 years of experience in this field.

She organizes a group and she is requesting a loan to buy thread to weave typical clothes. In the future she wants to increase her working capital to open a workshop and thus create jobs in her community.

The other members of the group engage in weaving typical clothes.

loans.use: To buy thread to weave typical clothes.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
This is Sonia. She previously took a 30,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial gain with happiness and gratitude in her heart. 

Sonia dreams of being successful in her business and hopes that her family will always be in good health. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Magarita

texts.en:
Magarita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Magarita has been in this business for six years now.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell. In the future, Magarita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 62 years old and married with eleven children. For the past 20 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as coffee, soy sauce, cereals, cream, soft drinks, sanitary napkins, and other products. With one child still in school, Guillerma works very hard to provide for her family.

Guillerma is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
Madeleine is 27 years old and married with three children between the ages of one and five. Her children are too young to go to school yet. For the past four years, Madeleine has been selling shoes. She is very happy with her previous loan that she used to boost her business.
