Madeleine is requesting a loan to buy more shoes to sell. She will use the profit from her loan to reinvest in shoes and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 59 years old and married with four children. She  works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Lorna has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Kadjaran in the Syunik region. She has a specialty in accounting, but she has never worked and she was always busy with care of her children. 

Finally they grew up (her daughter is married and she lives with her family) and now Marine has become engaged in farming and agriculture also. Marine is a widow and she lives with her son. They both work at the local school; Marine works there as a cleaner and her son as a worker. As Marine says their living would be just impossible without their farming activities. 

In their farm they breed cows, calves, a bull, and chickens. Marine has some loyal customers who buy milk, meat, and eggs from her farm. Since this year the winter is extremely cold and seems to be endless, Marine wants to have a great reserve of fodder for her farm cattle.

Marine asks a loan of 650,000 Armenian drams in order to buy hay and fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy hay and fodder for her farm cattle for the winter period

loans.name: Ma. Cherica

texts.en:
Ma. Cherica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Ma. Cherica requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Ma. Cherica has been in this business for two years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
Jojie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Jojie has been in this business for 2 years. Jojie earns additional income from a general store.

Jojie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 54 years old. She is married with four children. She has been selling shoes for the past ten years. She has requested a loan for buying more shoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used for adding more new items for sale. She is very happy with the past loan, which helped in the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to add more different kinds of shoes to her inventory.

loans.name: Xenia Danycela

texts.es:
Xenia, es madre de una hija de 6 años, es casada, su esposo es empleado, ella por la necesidad de apoyar en los gastos familiares se decidió a instalar una tienda y una pupuseria, la cual atiende de 6:00 a.m. A 10:00 p.m., lo hace con ayuda de dos empleadas.
El crédito le ayudara a comprar repollo, vinagre, quesillo, aceite, aderezos, entre otros ingredientes necesarios para trabajar, espera aumentar sus ventas, tener nuevos clientes, tener mejores ingresos con los que podrá continuar apoyando en los gastos familiares y cancelara sus cuotas.
Sueña con tener un local más grande y formar un patrimonio para su hija.
texts.en:
Xenia is married and she is the mother of a 6-year-old daughter. He husband is an employee. In order to help paying for the family’s expense she decided to set up a shop and a pupusería (a shop selling stuffed tortillas), working there form 6 am to 10 pm, counting on the help of two workers.
The loan she is requesting will help her buying cabbage, vinegar, quesillo, oil, decorations and other items she needs to work. She hopes to increase her sales, gain new customers and earn a better income thanks to which she will continue helping in paying for her family's expenses, as well as cancelling her credit. 
She dreams of owing a bigger shop and of creating an asset for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy cabbage, vinegar, quesillo, oil and decorations.

loans.name: Ansila

texts.en: Ansila is aged 50. She is a widow taking care of three children between the ages of 20 and 26. They all go to school. She runs a boutique and has been in the business for the past fifteen years. With the loan, she would like to buy more boutique items such as salt, rice and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, potatoes and salt for sale.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia y tiene tres hijos, como apoyo en los gastos familiares hace 10 años instalo una tienda en su casa de habitación, la atiende todos los días, de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m.
Comprará aceita, golosinas, pan, sal, azúcar, bebidas, etc., de esta manera surtirá el inventario de la tienda para dar mejor opción de compra a su clientes, espera tener nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
Aspira a tener un negocio mucho más rentable y financiar una carrera universitaria a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana, 44, lives in her own house and has three children.  She set up a store in her home 10 years ago to help with the family expenses.  She tends the store every day from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m.

She's going to buy oil, sweets, bread, salt, sugar, beverages, etc.  This way she'll stock her inventory and her customers will have better options.

Ana hopes to gain new customers, increase her sales, and earn better profits.  She wants to have a much more profitable store and pay for her children to go to college.

loans.use: to buy oil, sweets, bread, salt, sugar, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, handbags, shoes and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, onions, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Shaarbubu

texts.ru: Шаарбубу 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старшая дочь работает стоматологом, вторая дочь-студентка, а сын-ученик 11 класса. У Шаарбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шаарбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Шаарбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,200 сом (KGS). Увеличение скота является увеличением дохода и благосостояния ее семьи, поэтому Шаарбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шаарбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить денежные средства на дальнейшее обучение сына, так как сын в следующем году заканчивает школу и намерен поступить в медицинский университет.
texts.en:
Shaarbubu is 48 years old, married, and has three children with her spouse. Her oldest daughter is a dentist, the second is a college student, and the boy is in 11th grade. Shaarbubu has a high school education. To provide the primary source of income for the family Shaarbubu raises livestock. She began 15 years ago with the purchase of 6,000 som (KGS) of animals. Thanks to her tireless work, she now owns three milk cows and twenty-five sheep. Her monthly income is 3,200 som (KGS). 

Expanding her herd increases her income and the wellbeing of the family, so Shaarbubu came to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy calves. She plans to invest her earnings from use of the loan into further increasing the number of livestock she has, and she also plans to save for her son's continuing education, since he will graduate high school next year and intends to enter medical school.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Ulukbu

texts.ru: Улукбу 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Улукбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Улукбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Улукбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 3 овцы, 1 жеребец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Улукбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Улукбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Ulukbu is 43 years old, married and has five children together with her husband. Ulukbu has secondary education. As a main income for her family, Ulukbu works with livestock breeding, after having started this business 18 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Ulukbu's persistent work, her farm currently has three dairy cows, three sheep and one stallion. The monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Ulukbu turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase cows to fatten and subsequently resell at the market at a higher price. Ulukbu plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Good Hope Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth managed to buy  fabric material for sewing clothes like trousers, skirts and shirts for resale. She says the loan had a positive impact on her business and it resulted in her boosting her business in terms of working capital as well as profits. Elizabeth also says the loan improved her family life greatly in terms of improved food diet as well as adequate school fees. She sees herself owning a clothing shop that will be well stocked.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of $750 to buy fabric material and wool for knitting jerseys. She is more than grateful to the fundraisers.

loans.use: to buy fabric material for clothes manufacturing and wool for knitting jerseys.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a Cameroonian, age 31, married, with a child of two years. She has been in her secretarial business for over a year, which makes her experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

This loan will increase Jacqueline's turnover by 40 percent. Her standard of living will be improved, as well.

loans.use: to buy a complete computer.

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BEN sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. 
Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt  dans ce groupe qui évolue avec   l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Mme KADIA  qui occupe la prémière position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo,  fait le commerce de poissons dans ce groupe de femmes BEN. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  55 kg de poissons (20kg de frais et 35 kg poissons fumés). Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso.
Elle les revend à une place fixe au marché  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 fcfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the 'Ben' Group are all married women, with an average age of forty-one years, and an average of four children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Ouayerma I, a busy district in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This will be the third loan for the group, who work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the needs of their customers.  The previous loans have all been fully and correctly repaid.

Kadia (on the far right of the photo) sells fish.  She will use her loan to buy 55kg of fish (20kg of fresh fish, and 35kg of smoked fish).  She buys her supplies in Sikasso, and sells them from a fixed stall in the market, for cash, to both men and women.

Kadia expects to earn a monthly average of 30,000 francs CFA, and will use her earnings to repay her loan and interest, and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from the village of Calaocan. She is 50 years old and is married to Romeo, a father who is engaged in the farming business. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with six children. Three of them are still attending school.

Evelyn has been engaged in the hog-raising business for almost seven years. She usually earns about PHP 7,000 per head. Since three of her children still attend school, Evelyn and her husband work hand in hand to cover all their household expenses.

With her aim to improve the hog raising business, she has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed and vaccine for daily maintenance of her hogs. She believes that through her requested loan she can further secure her family's future and improve her way of living.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine for daily maintenance of her hogs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is married with two children and helps her husband on their farm to make a living. She also buys and sells charcoal in town and earns well from this. She had expanded their farm and needs money to finance the cost. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is hopeful to provide a better living for the family with their improved and greener farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Karina Lisseth

texts.es:
Karina, invertirá en la compra de cosméticos, lociones, cremas, gas propano, etc., para surtir la tienda, de esa forma fortalecerá su negocio de venta de gas propano y productos de bellez,para tener los ingresos que tanto necesita para cubrir los gastos familiares y cancelar las cuotas de la nueva deuda adquirida.
El crédito anterior le dio la oportunidad de mejorar sus ganancias con las cuales ha mejorado su economía y su vida familiar es mucho mejor. Hace dos meses nació un nuevo miembro de la familia la cual se encuentra en perfectas condiciones de salud.
texts.en: Karina will invest the loan to buy cosmetic products, lotions, creams, propane gas, etc. to stock her store. She will be able to increase her business of selling propane gas and beauty products.  Therefore, she will have the needed income to cover her household expenses and pay back her new debt. Her previous loan gave her the chance to improve her finances, and her family life is a lot better. Two months ago the family added a new member: a baby girl, who is in perfect health conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, lotions, creams, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is married and the mother of one child who earns a living by buying and selling cosmetics to people in her village. She collects cash and installment-plan payments from her customers. She uses her motorcycle to do this, and recently took out a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more cosmetic products to sell. She will also use a portion of this loan for vehicle repairs and maintenance. She hopes someday to have a stall in the local market where she can do her business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Len's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Len is a 33-year-old mother of two children. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming; she has been in this business for several years. To supplement the family’s income, she also works as a paid worker. The current business earns her about 17,000KHR per day to support the family. 

Len is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees in harvesting rice. She hopes to earn more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees in harvesting rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо мастерица и умелая швея. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и живет со своей семьей в городе Душанбе. Зулайхо у себя  дома занимается швейным делом. Она по заказу шьет таджикские женские платья. Зулайхо начала работать швеей 6 лет тому назад и до сих пор продолжает свое дело. Она шьет на старой машинке, но сейчас просит кредит, чтобы купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку. На новой машинке Зулайхо будет шить быстрее и качественнее. А также будет делать на платьях красивые вышивки. Таким образом она сможет увеличить количество своих клиенток и естественно увеличить доход.
texts.en: Zulaykho is an excellent and skilled seamstress. She is 47 years old, married, and lives with her family in the city Dushanbe. She does her sewing at home, where she makes Tajik women's dresses to order. Zulaykho began working as a seamstress six years ago, and has continued up to this day. She uses an old sewing machine, but is asking for a loan to buy a new, modern one. A new machine would allow her to sew better and faster. It will also be able to do beautiful embroidery on the dresses. In this way she will be able to attract more clients and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра родилась в 1968 году. Она опытная портниха. Гулчехра более 18 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она имеет свой швейный цех. Гулчехра имеет своих регулярных клиентов. Она старается предоставить свои услуги на высшем уровне. Она всегда в поиске новшества. Гулчехра замужем и имеет совершеннолетних детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она хочет купить обогреватель для своего швейного цеха, но не имеет денег, а также ей необходимо купить новую швейную машинку. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки обогревателя и швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulchehra was born in 1968 and she is an experienced seamstress.  For more than 18 years, she has been working as a seamstress and she has her own sewing shop with regular clients.  She strives to give the highest level of service and she is always in search of new trends.  Gulchehra is married and has grown children.  Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  She wants to buy a heater for her sewing shop, but she does not have enough money.  She also needs to buy a new sewing machine.  She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy a heater and a sewing machine.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a heater for her workshop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beers, juices, sodas, and spirits to resell in his business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a lady of 30 years, married to Joseph, and a mother of three children. She runs a retail shop and recently she started a charcoal-selling business. She has been in this business for three years now and she gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 (shillings).

This will be Grace's third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy charcoal to sell. In the future, Grace wants to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Vosilahkon

texts.ru: Восилахон жизнерадостная женщина. Она молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 23 года. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому 2 года. Восилахон после смерти мужа она стала единственной кормилицей своей семьи. Она более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги портнихи. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Восилахон имеет дополнительный доход от купли продажей сухофруктов. Она продает на местном рынке сухие абрикосы, сливу, а также миндаль. Восилахон хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Vosilahkon is a cheerful woman. She is young and purposeful. She is 23 years old. She is a widow and has one child to raise, a two-year-old. Vosilahkon became the sole provider for her family after her husband died.  For more than five years she has been a dressmaker, working from home. She earns additional income by selling dried fruit. She sells dried apricots and prunes, as well as almonds, at a local market. Vosilahkon wants to increase her working capital, so she is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to by dried fruit. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits to increase working capital

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marieta is 40 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Marieta has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her business, like rice, sugar, and coconuts.

Marieta has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business, like rice, sugar, and coconuts.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a PHP 11,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional goods to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hally

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Hally works hard to support her family. She runs a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Hally has been sustaining her business activities with her previous loan from NWTF.

Hally is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 9,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 20 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, nuevamente se siente con la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para efectuar la compra de semilla de marañón por mayor ya que es el momento preciso debido a la temporada y tiene que mantener reservas para poder trabajar mientras llega la próxima cosecha.
Con el préstamo anterior logro tener más clientes, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía, con lo que ha podido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ye vive en casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe feels the need to request another loan to buy cashew nuts wholesale, as this is the right season for them. She needs to increase her stock in order to be able to sell the cashew nuts until it is time for the next crop.

With her previous loan she was able to gain more clients, increase her sales and improve her savings, which has helped her improve her family's quality of life. Maria Guadalupe lives in her own home.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza is a kind, smart woman who lives in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is married, the mother of three children and began a livestock business 10 years ago with four sheep. Her business is successful but her income is still low. Her young son is ill and requires treatment but she does not have enough money to pay for it. She would like to send her oldest son to Russia to find a job because she needs his income to pay for the treatment. She is seeking a loan for 2,000 somoni to buy an airplane ticket to Russia. She is grateful for the support she receives.

loans.use: to buy airplane ticket to Russia for her son.

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie, who grows rice on his farmland, is 31 years old, married and has two children. He is thankful because his wife helps him in generating income to cover all of their basic needs.

To keep his farming business productive, Regie is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase 12 bags of fertilizers, two bags of pesticides and two bags of rice seeds. He is looking forward to approval of his request to help his business  improve.

loans.use: to purchase 12 bags of fertilizers, 2 bags of pesticides and 2 bags of rice seeds for his farming business

loans.name: Majani Ya Chai Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her mid 50's, is married with three children who all attend school. Asha has been running two businesses, a grocery business and selling cooked food. She has been in her businesses since 2004. Asha works from 8am to midnight and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Asha's fourth loan. She used the previous loans to buy cafe ingredients like soft drinks, bites and grocery drinks. Asha has also improved on her grocery business by starting cooking foods. She has paid back all of her previous loans successfully. Asha used her business profits to cover school fees for her grandkids and food expenses for her family. She will use this loan to buy beers, sodas, water, rice, maize flour, cooking oil and beans. She dreams to own a wholesale drinks shop. 

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "MAJANI YA CHAI" which consist of 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, water, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, and beans.

loans.name: Sokna's Group

texts.en: Sokna lives in a rural village in the Sangke district of Cambodia. She is 40 years old, single and makes a living by farming rice. She has been in this business for five years, and earns about 15,000 KHR per day to support her needs. She has taken out and repaid four previous loans from VisionFund, and now leads a group which is applying for a new loan. She plans to use her portion of this loan to cover the cost of harvesting her rice and buying fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María es una mujer activa, emprendedora y dinámica; a sus 25 años de edad ya es propietaria de su microempresa, un taller de confección que inició hace 8 años como su primera experiencia laboral. Presta sus servicios a terceros y cuenta con el apoyo de una hermana; tiene un cliente fijo al que le confecciona billeteras, por lo que tiene trabajo constante durante todo el año; así logra generar recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Su propósito y proyecto para un futuro cercano es hacer crecer su negocio y confeccionar su propia línea de prendas para mejorar la rentabilidad de su actividad; por ello trabaja diariamente con empeño, constancia y disciplina.
Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de comprar una máquina plana que le permitirá fortalecer su capacidad instalada con la que mejorará las condiciones de trabajo y aumentará la producción, pues con ella facilitará y agilizará la labor, permitiéndole entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna y logrando aumentar los ingresos que percibe.
De esta forma, María seguirá avanzando para lograr los objetivos que se propone y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
María is an active, enterprising and dynamic woman. At 25 years of age, she is already owner of a small business -- a tailoring shop that she started 8 years ago as her first work experience. She offers her services to third parties and counts on the support of her sister. She has one regular customer for whom she makes wallets, which is why she has constant work throughout the year.

Her aim and project for the near future is to grow her business and make her own line of clothing in order to increase the profitability of her business. That is why she works daily with determination, resolve and discipline.

She was inspired to apply for the loan in order to buy a tabletop sewing machine that will allow her to improve her production facilities, so that she can improve working conditions and improve her production. This will ease and speed up work, allowing her to deliver orders in an opportune fashion and increase the income that she receives.

In this way, María will continue moving forward to achieve her objectives and improve her family's living conditions and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a single woman with no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Sauda has operated a business selling clothing for the past two years. She sells  to town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chrib's Group

texts.en:
Chrib is a mother of seven children, 47 years old and a borrower from Moung Russey district in Battambang province. Currently, two of her children are in school. To support her family, Chrib has been rice farming and working as a paid worker for 23 years. This business has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is the fifth cycle for Chrib with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She successfully paid back her previous loan which has provided her family with a better living. Now she leads the group of three and the total requesting loan amount for her entire group is 3,600,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the group leader, Chrib is going to use her loan portion to pay for a reaping fee. She hopes that she will collect her yield on time with good income.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fee.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg (H) Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group loan will go to support "Kabita". She is the president of "Maa Tarini SHG" self help group and is pictured here as the lady standing with her hand raised. Most of the women in her group are working in dairy farming or own other small businesses in their village in Odisha, a state on the eastern coast of India.

With her portion of the loan, Kabita will buy more cows to increase her dairy farming business. Her husband works as a florist in the village, and they both support their one child together. 

After this loan, Kabita will be able to be more independent and help give her family a better standard of living. Kabita is an entrepreneur at heart and has big dreams of one day owning a large dairy farm.

The women in the group also plan to save the money they earn from expanding their businesses to buy a food processing machine, which they can all use to make spices and pickle vegetables together.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to increase her dairy farming business.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is 28 years old, living with her spouse and child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to have some savings so that she can provide better living quarters for her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Sadia's husband has been driving a motor rickshaw for several years; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Sadia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to buy the motor rickshaw’s body. She hopes that she would be able to make enough savings to meet the sudden needs of her family.

loans.use: pay for maintenance of her husband's rickshaw used for his business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old married father of one child. He is his family's sole breadwinner since his wife doesn't work.

Mohamad has worked in transportation for four years. His business is based on towing cars from one place to another for maintenance. His business is developing properly and gradually, but needs external support. He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to register his business to expand his working zone as requested by the Lebanese government. This loan will help him in covering more regions and will allow him to increase his transporting machines requested for such business.

He hopes that in the future he can buy more towing trucks and that he will spread to cover almost all of the Lebanese territories, through opening small branches in the regions.

loans.use: to register his business to expand his working zone as requested by the Lebanese government.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 40-year-old single lady, who  is the sole breadwinner for three members of her family.
Lina is a hardworking woman who has been selling clothes for 13 years to make sure that she can cover her own and her family’s needs.
Lina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter collection. This will increase her income and develop her standard of living.
Lina’s business is mobile and she doesn’t have a shop of her own. Her future plans will be concentrated on developing her business through opening her own stable clothing shop.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter collection which will increase her income and develop her living standards.

loans.name: Leon

texts.es:
León nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 55  años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre. 

León se siente alegre por el apoyo brindado y por el préstamo porque le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio,  él continua trabajando en su pequeña carpintería y en sus horas libres trabaja para una entidad del estado, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y otros materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo clavos, pintura y otras cosas más.

(La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
León was born in the city of Pilco - Grande and still lives there. He is 55 years old and in a common law relationship.

León is happy with the assistance he received. His previous loan was helpful because it helped to increase his business capital. He continues to work in his small carpentry shop and in his free time he works for a state entity. León is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy wood and other materials for his work such as nails, paint, and additional items.

The community of Pilco - Grande is located in the District of Huayllabamba, which is in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, paint, and other items for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La señora Rosalía tiene 42 años, ella sigue con la misma actividad del tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para la mujeres, tiene su taller y domicilio en la localidad de Batallas, este crédito es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  señora Rosalía va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas de fin de año que se acerca la navidad  tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz y el Alto, se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio, utilizara los beneficios en la compra de un motor para su movilidad ya que esta teniendo algunas fallas y este es su medio de transporte que le ayuda a dejar sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 42 years old and makes a living in knitting Alpaca wool sweaters and blankets for women. Her home and her studio are located in Batallas. 

This is her first loan cycle with this institution. Rosalía will use the loan to buy Alpaca wool wholesale so she can knit sweaters and blankets, since she has a lot of orders and deliveries to markets in La Paz and Alto around Christmas time and the end of the year.

She is happy and thankful for the opportunity Kiva lenders are giving her to grow her business. She will use the profits to buy a new motor for her vehicle, because the current one has been failing and she relies on this vehicle to deliver her orders.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en: Roziya is 38 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband passed away some years ago, so she is her family's sole breadwinner. Her goal is to comfort her children with a good life and all the modern conveniences. Fast developments in the modern world have made her children more progressive. She tries to provide them with a better quality of life, which is why 20 years ago she began her own business of sewing national women dresses. Thanks to the good service she provides, she has managed to gain many customers and improve her family's quality of life. She wants to develop her business further but to do this she needs to buy fabrics. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy the supplies she needs and thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
For the last 18 months, Harun has been running his business in Olkalou. He is a shopkeeper and sells items like sugar, sweets, maize flour and cooking fat.  He has applied for his first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya to enable him replenish stock in his shop.

His monthly income from his business is KES 7,000 and he intends to use the profits anticipated from his expanded business to educate his children, pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya, and to expand his business further.

Harun is 37 years old, married to Beatrice, and they are blessed with three children, aged five years, three years and three months old.  He hopes to have a prosperous future in business and family

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour, sweets and cooking fat to sell to his customers at the shop

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 8 years and 14. She describes herself as a focused woman . She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services and sells hair oil. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage container . Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will start a tea farming business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a water storage container.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 60 years old and is married with four children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening farm in the Philippines. Felicidad is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Felicidad has been in pig farming for 3 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She works hard to support her family. 

Lanie requested a loan of PHP 9,500 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.  Lanie has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Lanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Arquella

texts.en:
Arquella is 38 years old and married, with four children. With two children currently in school, Arquella works very hard to provide for them.

Arquella runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell, like bread, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Arquella has been in this business for five years and she sells a variety of items, such as bread, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like bread, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Geronica

texts.en:
Geronica works hard to support her family. Geronica is married and has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines.

Geronica requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell. She has been in this business for four years now.

Geronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en: As the married parent of five children, Geronima works hard to support her family. She does this by running an ice cream-making business in the Philippines, and supplements the income she earns there by selling fish. Geronima has requested a loan for PHP 29,500 from NWTF to buy ingredients to use when making ice cream. She has sustained her business activities over the last few years with 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream-making business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell kitchen cookware and appliances business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more kitchen products to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to be able to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen cookware and appliances to sell.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine and her family live in Kapan city. She has two daughters, who are already married and live with their families, and a son who lives with them. Karine has a specialty of nursing, but she has never worked. It has been many years now that she has been engaged in the clothes-trading business. She rents a stall in Kapan where she sells women's and men's clothes, underwear, shoes and boots, as well as children's clothes and shoes. 
She buys all her stall merchandise from the Yerevan wholesale market every month. She is sure that this loan, like her previous loan from Kiva, will bring success, good income and a lot of customers. 
Karine asks a loan of 1.100.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a winter clothing collection.

loans.use: to buy a winter clothing collection in order to make a good profit from Christmas and New Year sales.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 30 years old. She is married to a soldier and they have four children. She owns a bar and has been running this business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beers and other types of drinks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to invest and establish a food business.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell in her bar.

loans.name: Ana Dinora

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para incrementar su inventario comprara ropa y algunos utensilios de cocina, como cacerolas, ollas, lo que le servirá para que en estas fechas próximas de fin de fin de año tanga lo necesario para cumplir con sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior aumento sus ventas mejoro su economía, cancelo sus deudas y le permitió mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is asking for a new loan to increase her inventory of clothing and some kitchen utensils such as casserole dishes and pots.  These will be helpful over the end of year season so that she will have what she needs to meet her customer demand.

The previous loan helped her increase her sales and improve her financial situation.  She paid off her debt and improved her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing and kitchen items.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram, age 39, is from Kutaisi city, where he is a married father of two children, one of whom is attending university. He also looks after his retired mother. Guram used to work on house renovations, but he had to stop due to health problems. Currently, the only one who earns income in the household is Guram’s wife, who picks vegetables in local farmers’ greenhouses. 

Because he regrets not generating income, Guram is requesting a loan to start his own business. He has experience driving and wishes to buy a secondhand car to use in a taxi business. Guram wants to provide his family members with better living conditions and give them what they need. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Wendy Karolina

texts.es:
Wendy es una joven de 26 años de edad con un grado de estudio de primaria completa en un estado civil de unión libre siendo su pareja comerciante individual y madre de un hijo quien es menor de edad. A muy temprana edad ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra gracias a sus padres quienes han sido apoyo y pilar fundamental en su vida ya que por más de 2 años trabaja en la siembra y cultivo de hortalizas siendo su pareja quien se involucre como apoyo en el trabajo de campo junto a ella. Ella es una productora muy buscada en su localidad gracias a la calidad del producto que ella y su pareja producen limpio e higiénico, con un buen tamaño y un precio muy accesible para revender. La tierra que ella y su compañero de hogar cultivan es propia la cual está ubicada a 2 kilómetros de distancia al cual se trasladan para dar asistencia y mantenimiento.
Wendy ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abono, fungicidas que ayudaran al desarrollo, crecimiento y cuidado de sus cultivos de papaya como también la compra de y semilla certificada para cultivar.
Sus metas mejorar su calidad de vida, la ampliación de sus cultivos de papaya mediante la compra de más tierra para no solo depender de un solo producto si no también ofrecer una diversidad que permita generar mayores ingresos. Como madre apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios, dar la oportunidad para que se convierta en una persona profesional con muchas opciones en la vida.
texts.en:
Wendy is a 26-year-old woman who completed primary school and is in a common-law marriage.  Her partner is a merchant, and Wendy is the mother of a young son.  At a very early age, she learned to work the land thanks to her parents who were her support and foundation in life.  

For more than two years she has worked in planting and cultivating vegetables.  Her partner helps to work the field next to hers.  Wendy is a highly sought after producer in her town thanks to the quality of product that she and her partner produce.  It is clean and hygienic, a good size, and has an affordable price for reselling.  The land that she and her partner work is theirs; it is located 2 kilometers away.  They travel that distance to provide assistance and maintenance.

Wendy has asked for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, manure, and fungicide to help with the development, growth, and care of her papaya crops, as well as to buy certified seeds for planting.

Her goals are to improve their quality of life, expand her papaya crops by purchasing more land so that she does not only rely on one product, but also offer a variety that would allow her to generate more income.  As a mother, she wants to help her son in school and give him the opportunity to become a professional with many options in life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and certified papaya seeds to grow.

loans.name: Mustafe Ahmed

texts.en: Mustafe Ahmed is 20 years old and a secondary school student. He wants to start his education at a local university, after he finishes his work at his current school. To do this, he needs a laptop, and has requested that Kaaba give him a loan so that he can buy it. He will repay the loan in installments. After entering university, Mustafe hopes to learn Information Technology.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Rwebicoori Bika Oguze Group

texts.en: The group is from a predominantly farming village that is well-known for maize production from which it derives the name Rwebicoori, literally meaning a maize area. Robert (raising his hand), a member of the group, buys and sells maize. This being a harvest season for the maize, he wants to buy from the farmers in bulk at harvest before the prices hit the ceiling. The challenge right now has been limited capital. He hopes, if given the loan, that his worries will cease. He can then store the maize and sell it to schools after the harvest season when the prices have gone up. He is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Reina Pricila

texts.es:
Doña Reina de 37 años de edad curso hasta el quinto grado de primaria es casada y madre de 3 hijos varones, el primero tiene 17 años y curso el 1 año de bachillerato, el segundo tiene 15 años y cursa el segundo curso de ciclo común y el ultimo de 6 años está en primer grado. Su negocio es el cultivo de café y maíz en menor escala, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años ya que lo heredo de sus padres vendiendo sus productos en otra comunidad cercana. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 40 minutos al cual se traslada caminando involucrándose todos los miembros de su familia ya que es necesario por el bajo costo del café y si pagan quien les ayude a recolectar les disminuye las ganancias.
Su meta hacer crecer su negocio, esto invirtiendo sus ganancias en la compra de terreno para poder sembrar y ampliar sus activos para dejar una herencia digna a sus tres hijos y la puedan seguir trabajando. Como madre apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios de manera que ellos puedan ser personas profesionales, con carreras universitarias que les ayuden a formar sus negocios, empresas, etc. enfrentando la vida de manera positiva para el bienestar de sus familias.
Ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL el cual invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos de café que son 3 manzanas la mayoría es nueva y necesita asistencia para el desarrollo del grano, protección y crecimiento de la planta.
texts.en:
Doña Reina who is 37 years old studied until the 5th grade of elementary school, she is married and a mother of 3 sons. Her oldest son is 17 years old and studied until the 1st year of high school; the middle child is 15 years old and currently in his 2nd year of middle school, and the youngest one is 6 years old and in his 1st year of elementary school. Her business is the cultivation of coffee and corn on a small scale. She has been dedicated to this activity for several years now since she inherited it from her parents by selling their products in a nearby community. Her coffee plantations, to which she goes by foot, are located 40 minutes away from her home. All the members of her family are involved in this activity because the price of coffee is low and hiring someone else to help them would reduce their profits.

Her goal is to make her business grow by investing her profits in the purchase of land to sow, and to increase her assets so she can leave her sons a decent inheritance in which they can keep on working. As a mother, her goal is to support them in their studies so they can become professionals with university careers that will help them to form their own businesses, companies, etc. by confronting life in a positive way for the well-being of their families.  

She has requested a loan to the cooperative COMIXMUL, which will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer for her coffee plantations, which have the size of 3 blocks. The plantations are new and in need of assistance for the development of the grain, protection and growth of the plant.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to use on her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира добродушная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет детей. Со своей семьёй Нодира живёт в маленьком посёлке. Чтобы зарабатывать на проживание, она с мужем много работают. Сама является портнихой, дома для этого дела она имеет швейную машинку. Принимает заказы на дому и зарабатывает этим на проживание. Муж Нодиры уже боле 15 лет работает сварщиком. Эта работа также приносит ему хороший доход. Сейчас Нодира с мужем хотят отремонтировать свой дом, который пришёл уже в негодное состояние. В доме нужно заменить полы, крышу и окна. Но для этого нужна большая сумма денег. Из за нехватки денежных средств Нодира обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит. На полученный кредит она хочет купить строительные материалы, а также половые доски, окна и двери. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за  своевременную поддержку и в дальнейшем надеется на сотрудничество.
texts.en: Nodira is a kind and hardworking woman. She is married and has children. Nodira lives with her family in a small town. To earn a living, she and her husband work hard. She has a sewing machine at home for her work as a seamstress. She takes orders and completes them to earn her living. Her husband has worked as a welder for over 15 years. This work earns him a good income. Now Nodira and her husband want to make repairs to their home, which has fallen into an unsuitable state. The floors, roof and windows need to be replaced. However, it will take a lot of money. Since they do not have enough money, Nodira came to Arvand and would like to take out a loan. She wants to use the loan to buy building materials as well as floor boards, windows, and doors. She thanks Arvand in advance for the timely support and hopes to work together again in the future.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Ann. Barabhuja Shg Group

texts.en:
Chinamayee is a 34-year-old lady living with her husband, parents-in-law and two children, aged nine years and five years in a small village of Odisha, India. 

In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Chinamayee. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman having a leadership trait within her. She stepped out from her house and made a group with other women from her village and gave the name "Ann. Barabhuja SHG" to the group. All the group members are doing some business to support their families. All the group members support and help each other in their business activity.

Chinamayee has been engaged in the spice-making business for the last four years. She purchases raw spices like turmeric, ginger, white pepper, black salt, chilies, etc. and makes mixed spices using a grinder machine. From this activity, she earns 2,000 INR per month. She wants to expand her business, and for this she requires financial support.

So she, along with her group members, is asking for a loan amount of 250,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a new grinder machine and raw spices in bulk for her spice-making business. 

She says, "In the future, I want to be a big manufacturer of spices." She is also saying, "I am very grateful to Kiva for supporting my business".

loans.use: to pay for a new grinder machine and raw spices in bulk for her spice-making business.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 51 years old lives with his wife and 4 children in Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. 

His wife, Ganchimeg, is unemployed and stays at home to take care of their children and family. His older daughter is a university student,  2 of his younger children attend local school and the youngest child stays at home with her mother.
 
Batsaihan is a driver at a local company and works shifts. He has recently started manufacturing traditional boots at home with his wife, to increase their family income. They are hardworking, responsible and positive people. Batsaihan needs 500,000 MNT to purchase material to produce  traditional boots to sell before the Lunar New Year when the demand is high.

loans.use: to purchase material to produce more traditional boots to sell before the Lunar New year, when the demand is high.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his vehicle and buy leather for his wife's boot-making business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina has a business operating a motorcycle transport as well as a rental business to earn extra income. She needs to find ways to support her children's education. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to finance the cost of motor maintenance for the motorcycle used in the business. In the near future, she plans to acquire additional motorcycles for business expansion.

loans.use: to finance the cost of motor maintenance.

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en: Zaverio is 47 years old, married and the father of four children. He and his family live in Fort Portal, Uganda, where he has worked as a tailor since 1998. He supplements his income by working as a farmer, but has limited capital for expansion. His income is also affected by seasonal changes on his farm. His goal for the future is to have a better sewing machine that will allow him to serve his customers more easily. He is requesting this loan to buy more clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Veronica

texts.es:
Nancy, se decidió por otro crédito para surtir el inventario de la tienda y la venta de pupusas, comprara granos básicos, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, bebidas y golosinas, le servirá para mejorar sus ventas y atraer a nuevos clientes.
El capital anterior le ayudo a adquirir mercadería nueva para ofrecerla a mejor precio, sus ingresos son mayores, tiene nuevos clientes y su aporte a los gastos familiares son mayores.
texts.en:
Nancy decided upon another loan in order to stock her store and for her ‘pupusa’ [stuffed tortillas] sales.  She will buy basic grains, cooking oil, fried pork rinds, soft cheese, soft drinks, and sweets.  This will serve to improve her sales and to attract new customers.

The previous loan helped her to get new merchandise to offer at better prices.  Her sales are greater, she has new customers, and her contribution to the family expenses is greater.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cooking oil, fried pork rinds, soft cheese, soft drinks, and sweets.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Jane has been selling goats' meat at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase more goats for her business

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Encarnacion De Jesus

texts.es: Don Encarnación es originario de la ciudad de Managua, Soltero y padre de cinco hijos cuatro de ellos ya independientes. De 50 años de edad. Se dedica al negocio de vulcanización. Inicio su negocio como ayudante en un negocio de reparación de llantas donde adquirió experiencia, poco a poco con dinero propio decidió poner su pequeño negocio y  ha ido prosperando notablemente. Solicita el crédito para la compra de: Llantas de segunda mano y materiales de vulcanización. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Encarnación hails from the city of Managua. He is single and father to five children, four of whom are already independent. He is 50 years old and makes his living in the vulcanization business. He started out as an assistant in a tire repair business where he got experience. Little by little, he started his own business with his own money, and it has thrived considerably.

His is applying for the loan to buy secondhand tires and materials for vulcanization. He anticipates that the loan will be of great help since he will be able to offer his customers better service. His future plan is to improve the infrastructure of his house.

loans.use: to buy secondhand tires and materials for vulcanization.

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
Phea is a resident from Moung Russey district of Baatambang province. She is 53 years old and a mother of seven children. Currently, five children still rely on her as four are in school and one is too young for schooling. To strive for a living, Phea and her husband do rice farming and work for others for a fee. This business has returned her about 34,400 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth cycle for Phea and a co-borrower and the third cycle for a remaining borrower in this group of three with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid back, has helped Phea to improve her living condition better than before. The total requested amount for her group is 3,200,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is Phea's loan portion. As a leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for a reaping fee. Phea hopes to harvest rice on time and to earn more income from her cash-crop.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fee

loans.name: Anjaz Group

texts.en: Anjaz Group consists of five women living in Sana'a, Yemen. Aqla, age 51, is a member of the group. She is a housewife and a mother. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her family with a better future. She has applied for a loan to be able to buy a gas cooker for her home. She has been unable to buy this item her family needs because of a lack of money. She hopes to help improve her family's living conditions. She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate his restaurant, painting and replacing the flooring as well as purchasing new tables and chairs

loans.name: Hajira

texts.en:
Hajira is a 35-year-old woman, living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband had been driving an auto rickshaw, paying a daily fare to use it. With the help of savings, he bought a used auto rickshaw; its engine’s condition is good, but the body is fully damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving, but is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, Hajira requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a new rickshaw body and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. 

Hajira hopes that her husband will now be able to generate more income because he does not need to pay a daily fare to anyone.
 
Hajira is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband's rickshaw used in his business.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a married woman from CPG, Bohol and the mother of three grown-up children. Sylvia operates a motorcycle transport business with her husband. This is the source of their income. 
Sylvia is asking for a loan to buy wheel tires, chains, nuts and bolts. Sylvia hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy wheel tires, chains, nuts and bolts

loans.name: Bibikhon

texts.en:
Bibikhon is smart and hard-working woman. She is married with 4 children that they love very much. She lives in a  house with her family.

She sells a variety of food items. She sells her goods in a food shop. She acquires her products in shopping centers in the city, making periodic buying trips. She began working this way over 6 years ago because she needed to earn money. Currently, her partner helps her to purchase her merchandise.  She wants to increase her working capital for New Year season. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy food items for improve her stock. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items for her market.

loans.name: Bilkizoy

texts.en:
Bilkizoy is a hard-working woman. She was born in 1988. She is married but has no money. She is a seamstress. Bilzikoy’s husband is a migrant worker in Russia. He doesn’t send enough money to her and that’s why she must earn her own living. She sews wonderful dresses. Thanks to her high quality service, she has her regular clients. 

Bilkizoy’s husband came home from Russia some months ago and now he is going back to Russia again, but he has not enough money to buy an air ticket. Bilzikoy is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to buy an air ticket for her husband. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for her husband

loans.name: Ninel

texts.en:
This nice and clever lady, whose name is Ninel, lives in Kapan city. She is 37 years old. Ninel is divorced and she lives with her son, who is school-aged. 

Ninel has graduated Yerevan State University and, after her graduation, she has worked at the school for 15 years as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. This year, she has been awarded with the title of Best Teacher and this is because she does her work with a great sense of duty, care, and love towards the children, whom she educates and teaches to always be fair and honest in all human relations. She also has 12 pupils whom she gives private courses of Armenian Language and Literature and prepares them for entrance examinations.

Ninel asks for a loan of AMD 800,000 (Armenian drams) in order to buy a computer, some professional literature, and she also wants to furnish her living room more comfortably, since that is where she and her pupils have their courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature, and to furnish her living room more comfortably.

loans.name: Serob

texts.en:
Serob is 29 years old and he lives in Yerevan. Serob is one of the best and most responsible clients of Nor Horizon and Kiva. 

This will be Serob’s second loan from Kiva. The first loan he used to purchase of gold for his business. For several years he had worked as a minibus driver, but then he changed his work to what he is engaged in now. He works at one of the biggest wholesale markets for gold in the city. He rents a small workshop where he works and makes unbelievably nice and precious jewelry. All of the jewelry he makes, his mother sells at the same wholesale market at a rented stall. 

Serob is married and he has a very pretty daughter and very soon his son will be born. Since his family is going to become larger, Serob also works part-time at a gas-station in order to be able to meet all of the needs of his beloved family.

Now Serob needs a loan of 2500 dollars in order to buy gold, precious and semiprecious stones since before the Christmas and New Year’s holidays the price of gold becomes lower and it also means that he may have a lot of orders.

loans.use: to buy gold and precious, semiprecious stones

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 21-year-old Foday. He is single and has no children. He has one dependent, his grandmother. He is assisting her because of her old age. 
He is still doing his gara tie-dying. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 
Foday would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Foday requires a loan in order to buy phone accessories, electrical bulbs and CD disks.
Foday's plans to build are still on hold but he has expanded his business by buying a refrigerator to sell cold water and drinks, He also has a commercial motor bike. This loan will help to generate more income. He is a hard-working and honest businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories, electrical bulbs and CD disks.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, surtirá su negocio para las próximas fechas navideñas, por lo que necesita capital para comprar aceite, pan, bebidas, frijoles, cocos, entre otros, le servirán para mejorar su inventario y aprovechar que las ventas aumentan un poco.
Con el crédito anterior pudo aumentar la mercadería de su tienda lo que le permitió aumentar sus utilidades y mejorar su calidad de pago, su familia se encuentra mus saludable y continúan brindándole el apoyo para salir adelante juntos.
texts.en:
Maria will stock her business for the next holiday dates for which she needs capital to buy oil, bread, drinks, beans, coconuts, among other items. They will serve to improve her inventory and take advantage of sales increasing a little.

With the previous loan, she was able to expand the merchandise in her store which allowed her to increase her profits and improve her payment quality. Her family is now healthier and continues providing the support to get ahead together.

loans.use: to buy oil, bread, drinks, beans and coconuts.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима добродушная и отзывчивая женщина. Она родилась и живёт в кишлаке. Фотима вдова, и имеет на иждивении одного ребёнка. Всё своё время она посвящает  воспитанию своего единственного ребёнка. Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание, она занимается своим бизнесом. Фотима разводит скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, и тем более ей удобно заниматься этим делом в той местности, где она живёт. У неё сейчас имеется несколько голов скота, которых она выращивает. Но для расширения своего бизнеса она хочет закупить ещё несколько голов скота, чтобы в будущем успешно их продать и иметь денежные средства для удовлетворения всех имеющихся нужд своей семьи. Фотима также хочет построить коровник для своих скот. По этой причине Фотима обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Fotima is a kind and sympathetic woman. She was born and still lives in this village. Fotima is a widow, and has one dependent child. She spends all her time caring for her one child. In order to earn a living, she has her own business raising livestock. The business earns a good income, and it is also easy for her to run the business where she lives. She now has a few head of livestock which she is raising. However, she wants expand her business by buying a few more animals which she can then sell at a profit to earn money to meet the needs of her family. Fotima also wants to build a small barn for her animals. For that reason Fotima is asking Arvand for a loan to buy livestock. She hopes for a good result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe KELEGNA sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles polygamiques à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec   l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Mme ASSETOU, occupe la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo,  fait la vente de miel dans ce groupe de femmes KELEGNA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  30 litres de miel. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville.
Elle les revend à une place fixe au marché  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000fcfa dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kelegna group are married women who average 40 years of age with five children each. They live in polygamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the working-class districts of the town on Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region. 

They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can satisfy customer demand. Their previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Assetou, who is on the far right of the photo, is the member of the Kelegna group who sells honey. With her loan she is planning to buy 30 liters of honey. She gets her supplies in Sikasso town and resells them for cash at a fixed place in the market and within her family to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, of which part will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it; the rest will be put into her savings.

loans.use: to buy honey.

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  LA PAIX sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogamiques à   ATTBOUGOU  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  NASSITAN  fait le commerce de tissus  dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est en première  position de la  droite vers la    gauche sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  20 pièces de pagnes. Sa vente se fait  sur place à un clientèle composé pour la plus part de femme au contant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the La Paix group are married women who average 37 years of age with four children each. They live in monogamous families in Attbougou, one of the working-class districts of the town on Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region.

They are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can satisfy customer demand. 
Within the group, Nassitan, who is on the far right of the photo, buys and sells fabrics. With her loan she is planning to buy 20 pieces of "pagne" (brightly colored fabric). She sells her products locally for cash to a customer base made up principally of women.
She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA, of which part will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it; the rest will be put into her savings. 

Her ambition is to increase her turnover so that she can provide more customer satisfaction.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes".

loans.name: Oyimbiby

texts.en: Oyimbiby was born in 1983. She is married and has two children. Oyimbiby lives with her family in a rural area. She started in business with animal husbandry but changed her business some years ago. Now she sews national dress for women. She has regular customers. With her profits, she bought a house, but it is in bad condition. Oyimbiby wants to repair her house and, for this purpose, she is applying for a loan of 10,000 TJS (Tajikistan Somoni) to buy building materials, including cement, soil and paint, to use in repairing the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials, including cement, soil and paint, to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her new general store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more plastic shoes, plastic utensils and fruits for her business. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic shoes, plastic utensils and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She is applying for a loan to buy more bags of maize to be ground. She is grateful for the new support she will receive.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize to be ground.

loans.name: Mehriban

texts.en:
Mehriban and her family have benefited from the Kiva program. A previous loan has helped her and her husband to purchase an engine for their woodcutting saw.  They are satisfied with the money that they earn through this business and would like to continue to do this kind of work.  They hope to get a second loan so they can improve their living conditions and have healthy food. 

Meribane requests a second loan because she needs to repair their woodcutting machine which is in need of repair due to the constant wear and tear.  She wants to continue to provide  effective and efficient services, especially in the last few months of the cold season. 

It is through this work that they care for their family and she hopes to be able to provide an opportunity for a better education for her children. Thus far, they have only been able to finish primary school since the lack of money has kept the older children from being able to attend secondary school. 

Mehriban believes that this second loan will improve her husband’s business dramatically as it will help him be more efficient in his work and produce larger quantities in a shorter period of time. 

They really appreciate all Kiva lenders for the loan and their help to achieve the family's goals.

loans.use: to to repair  her woodcutting machine.

loans.name: Chantara

texts.en:
Chantara, aged 25 and single, is a local villager from Kandal Stueng district of Kandal province. He grows rice as the main source of income. He has been in this business for two years and earns 10 USD per day.
